Para poder readecuar su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, cemento y pintura. En el futuro quiere tener una panadería para tener un ingreso adicional y mejorar la vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 39 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He is a photographer. His two children are 8 and 6 years old, respectively. He has been a photographer for several years. He had to choose this occupation to support his family because of a lack of other opportunities. He had to buy a camera and a computer to digitalize the photos. Little by little, with the help of his wife, he acquired a small photography store. Now he and his wife work late into the night because they have many customers. For the growth of his business, he wants to buy tables, glue, and paint with this loan. In the future, he would like to have a bakery in order to earn additional income and improve the life of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables, glue, and paint

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Natif de Koutiala, Monsieur Issa Traoré a 39 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec ses femmes  et ses enfants dans le quartier Koko  de la ville de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ). 
Monsieur  Issa Traoré n’a pas  été à  l’école,  c’est pour cela qu’il n’a pas prit du temps à s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis  son jeune âge auprès   de son père commerçant. 
Il est bien connu dans la vente de plastiques et  divers autres articles, il reçoit des commandes   à travers les petits détaillants de la ville de Koutiala. 
Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité et en quantité, il a décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles en plastiques à Bobo Dioulaso au Burkina Faso. 
Il a une boutique de vente de plastique au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente tous les jours à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit. 
Avec  ce nouveau prêt, Issa Traoré compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des  d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités.
texts.en:
A native of Koutiala, Mr. Issa Traoré is a 39-year-old married father of three. He lives with his wives and children in the Koko neighborhood of Koutiala in the Sikasso region. Because Mr. Traoré did not attend school, he became involved very early on in business activities with his shopkeeper father. He is well known for the sale of plastics and other items, and receives orders through small retailers in the city of Koutiala. To satisfy his clients in both quantity and quality, he is working with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to purchase a large number of plastic items in Bobo Dioulaso, Burkina Faso. Mr. Traoré has a plastics store in the large market of Koutiala and sells daily to a customer base made up of men and women, both for cash and for credit. With this new loan, Issa Traoré expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000FCFA, which he plans to use to pay back the interest to Soro Yiriwaso, improve living conditions for his family, and invest in his business.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various plastic products

loans.name: Las Entusiastas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo y todas trabajan en sus actividades.
 Una de las integrantes es la señora Secundina O. con 50  años de edad, ella tiene una despensa en su casa.
Sus compras de mercaderías  lo realiza en  M. de Abasto para e aprovechar el precio. 
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar del M. acomoda sus mercaderías y abre el negocio y atiende con su hija y a la siesta  realiza las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con su hija ya que es madre soltera.   
De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  su  hija que estudia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne, jamón, queso, huevos, panificados, mandioca, fideos.
texts.en:
This committee is currently in its 3rd cycle and all the members are working at their various activities. One of the members is Mrs. Secundina O., 50. He has a grocery store in her home. She buys her merchandise in the local wholesale foodstuffs market in order to take advantage of the prices. She’s a very long-suffering person that has a very exhausting day because upon arriving from the market she has to arrange her merchandise. Her daughter helps her tend to the store. During the midday rest period she has to do all her household chores. She does all this in order to get ahead in life because she’s a single mother. She is able thus to meet household expenses and to pay for her daughter’s education. She is asking for funds to buy meat, ham, cheese, eggs, baked goods, manioc and pasta.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, ham, cheese, milk, eggs, cooling oil, manioc, pasta, and others.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El señor Pastor F. O. tiene  42 años es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la zona de la colorada radial 13 zona sud de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra.

El se dedica a la construcción como albañil, por el momento trabaja en la construcción de un mercado en la zona de la radial 10 zona de la Villa Primero de Mayo. El cuenta con escasos recursos por los cuales no puede arreglar su propio vehículo en el cual se desplaza a su trabajo ya que esta zona queda lejos de su casa  y en este invierno el transporte publico se hace escasos. Es por este motivo que el necesita arreglar su vehículo ya que también le sirve de una herramienta de trabajo alternativa ya que cuando no trabaja como albañil utiliza su automóvil y trabaja como Taxista.

Su Mayor sueño es poder en un futuro poder formar una familia y construir una casa para su familia con sus propias manos.
texts.en:
El señor Pastor F. O. is 42 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in zone La Colorada Radial 13, south of the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. He is a builder. At the moment, he is building a market in zone Radial 10, zone of the Villa Primero de Mayo. Because he has limited resources, he is unable to fix his car. Thus, he can't get to work because zone Radial 10 is far from his home and public transportation this winter is very limited. In addition, he has used his car as a taxi to provide himself with other work when he wasn't working in construction. His biggest dream is to form a family and build a house for his family with his own hands.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Aoua

texts.fr:
Madame Aoua Traoré est âgée de 34 ans, mariée mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier de  Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Aoua  n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui justifie son intégration dans le commerce qu’elle apprit auprès de sa mère depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle s’est finalement initiée à l’achat la vente d’articles divers (tels les tissus, chaussures, et autres) depuis 11 ans.  Madame Aoua  Traoré est très  sollicitée et appréciée par ses clients pour la qualité de ses articles.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Aoua  a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a  3 ans. Après avoir  4 prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel dont le précédent a été bien payé.  
Elle compte acheter, 20 pièces  de pagnes wax avec ce prêt.  
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente en ville  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant  et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aoua Traoré is a 34 year old married mother of four. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband and children in the Koulikoro neighborhood of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). For sociocultural reasons Aoua never went to school, which is why she is now practicing the business she learned at her mother's knee. After unsuccessfully trying a number of different activities, she settled into buying and selling assorted goods (fabrics, shoes, etc.) 11 years ago. She is greatly sought after, and her clients appreciate her because of the quality of her goods. In order to grow her business and satisfy her clients, Aoua decided to join the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. She has been a part of 4 group loans and is now requesting her second individual loan; all her previous loans were repaid on time. She plans to buy 20 wax print wraps with this loan. She buys her goods at the Koutiala market and sells them in town for cash or credit, to a clientele of both women and men. She expects to earn 90,000 francs per month income which she will use to make loan repayments, contribute to the daily expenses of the family, and re-invest into her business.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax print wraps

loans.name: In God We Trust. Group

texts.en:
Tenneh G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. Tenneh is 31 years old, single, and has one child who is 8 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for two siblings.

For 7 years, she has been selling red oil and dried fish in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 33,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more red oil and dried fish.

She describes herself as a jovial person.

Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Comfort B. is inset at the lower right because she was not present during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more red oil and dried fish

loans.name: Rosa Maribelt

texts.es: Rosa Maribelt tiene 43 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para sus hijos y familia, los créditos anteriores han sido muy gratificantes para su negocio. Ella indica que le ha ido bien en el negocio pero siempre está buscando la forma de cómo atraer a sus clientes. Solicita este crédito para poder comprar una amplia variedad de productos como pintura de uñas, lápiz labial, tratamientos, ropa usada y perfumes. Siempre sueña con tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Rosa Maribelt is 43 years old. She sells general merchandise. She is always looking for a way to generate income for her children and her family. The previous loans have been very rewarding for her business. She indicates that it has been going well in her business. Nevertheless, she is always looking for a way to attract more customers. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy an ample variety of products like nail polish, lipstick, treatments, used clothes, and perfumes. She always dreams of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eduardo Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez es una persona joven y dedicada a su trabajo, él desde muy temprana edad tuvo que trabajar porque su padre era una persona dedicada a la bebida es por esta razón que desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar como ayudante en un taller mecánico.

Al pasar los años el se independizo y actualmente trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “COPACABANA”, se levanta por la mañana para empezar su cotidiana labor, Eduardo tiene muchas ganas de auto superarse y así para en un futuro no muy lejano el este capacitado para formar un hogar con las comodidades que él no pudo gozar en su niñez y adolescencia.

El señor Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros y los directivos del sindicato para poder solicitar un crédito destinado  para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder facilitar la vida que lleva y así poder mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez is a young person who is devoted to his work. He had to work at a very young age because his father drank a lot. That is why he started working as an assistant in a mechanic’s shop when he was very young. As the years passed he became independent. He currently works in the Copacabana “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) syndicate. He gets up in the morning to start his daily work. Eduardo has a great desire to improve himself. In the near future he will be prepared to set up his house with the comforts he was not able to enjoy in his childhood. Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez came to CIDRE to request a loan because of what his colleagues and the board of directors of the syndicate told him. He will use the loan to by a vehicle (motorcycle) that would help simplify his life. That way he will be able to improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Balimaya I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot.
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SADIO C. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1,1 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA environ par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya I group are married women who are on average 43 years old with 3 children, and mainly live in polygamous families in Missiritou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali. They are working with the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities during the beginning of the lean season. They cultivate millet, groundnut and beans. They are requesting their second loan; the first was repaid on time. With this new loan, Sadio C. will buy some supplies and small equipment and pay for labour to maintain about 1.1 hectares of millet and groundnut. The harvest will be sold in the cities of Dioïla and Massigui, to a clientele of both men and women. They expect to earn an average income of 45,000 francs per season.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo  nació en la ciudad de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Consuelo vive en la misma ciudad junto con sus hijos. Consuelo es madre y padre para sus hijos, ya que su pareja la abandono por otra mujer. Decidida a continuar su vida, en el año 1993 abrió un restaurante donde vendía almuerzo. Actualmente, Consuelo se dedica a la venta comestibles en su tienda que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de pan. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Consuelo  que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Consuelo es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios pusieron de nombre “Señor de Torrechayoc” a su banco comunal en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Consuelo was born in the city of Urubamba which is about an hour and ten minutes from Cusco. Consuelo currently lives there with her two children. She serves as both mother and father to her children since her partner left her for another woman. Determined to get on with her life, in 1993, she opened a restaurant selling lunches. Today she sells food from a store in her home. You can find her there 7 days a week from 5 am to 10 pm or until she runs out of bread. She has been doing this for several years and it has gone well thanks to her effort. Consuelo hopes to borrow 1500 nuevos soles as part of her new loan. She would like to use the loan to buy more goods such as rice, sugar and others. The Señor de Torrechayoc community bank was founded in 1994 with Consuelo as one of the founding members which has been very good for her. The partners named the community bank Señor de Torrechayoc in honor of the city of Urubamba's patron since they are all religious.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more goods such as rice, sugar and others

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Jesús Vásquez A. es una persona que fue abandonada por su esposa y es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación el primero tiene 9 años el estudia por las mañanas y por las tardes ayuda en la alimentación de ganado porcino, el segundo tiene 5 años también está en kínder el cual aun es muy joven para ayudar en las labores y quehaceres de la familiares y por ultimo tiene una niña de 3 años de edad a la cual cuida su madre que vive junto a ellos y ayuda en la educación de sus nietos.

El Señor Jesús se levanta a muy tempranas horas por las mañanas para ir a la parada de minibuses para agarrar el turno que le corresponde y así poder  empezar su labor semanal,  el viaja dos veces al día y tres veces a la semana, los demás días el se dedica al cultivo de pequeños cultivos y la cría de ganado porcino,  para así poder llevar el sustento de su hogar y darles lo mejor a su familia.

El cliente se entero de este crédito por la radio ya que constantemente pasan una propaganda,  que se dan créditos en CIDRE, el se aproximo a las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para incrementar sus cabezas de ganado porcino. Su mayor sueño es en un futuro tener una pequeña granja de Ganado Porcino.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Vásquez A.’s wife left him with three children to support. He sees to the education of his three children. The oldest is 9 years old and goes to school in the morning and helps out in the afternoons feeding the pigs. The second child is five years old and is in Kindergarten and still too young to help with chores. The youngest is a 3-year-old daughter who is cared for by their grandmother who lives with them and helps raise the grandchildren. Jesús rises very early in the morning to go to the minibus stop to take on his shift and start his weekly work. His run is twice daily and three times a week. The rest of the days he spends tending to his small crops and to raise pigs in order to provide for his home and give the best to his family. He found out about these loans through the radio because there are ads constantly about CIDRE loans. He called upon the offices to request funds to increase his pig herd size. His greatest wish is to have a small pig farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia reside en la colonia san José departamento de Morazán san francisco gotera, ella vive con su hijo de 38 años el cual tiene problemas mentales y las medicinas se las compra de lo que ella obtiene de la venta de tortillas.
Ella vende tortillas dos veces al día en la mañana comienza a preparar a las 7 y en la tarde a las 3 y termina de vender a las 5 de la tarde, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 29 años. 
El crédito lo invertirá una cantidad para la compra de maíz y leña y la otra parte para ponerle energía eléctrica a su casa porque no tiene y el no tener energía le dificulta para levantarse temprano a empezar el procedimiento de las tortillas.
Esto le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su hijo y de esta manera salir adelante con su negocio ya que la situación económica está muy difícil.
Sus aspiraciones es tener energía en su casa y lograr tener las medicinas de su hijo a disposición
texts.en:
Cecilia is a resident of the San Jose colony of the Morazan San Francisco Gotera region. She lives with her 38-year old son who is handicapped. The medicines tha the needs are purchased with her earnings from selling tortillas. She sells tortially two times per day, starting to make them at 7 in the morning. She sells at 3pm and by 5pm she has sold out. She has been running her business for 29 years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, firewood, and a part will be used to bring electricity to her home. She has a difficult time getting up to make tortillas in the morning when it's still dark. This loan will help her improve the living conditions for herself and for her son. She would like to see an improved success because their financial situation is currently very difficult. Her hopes are to have electricity in her home and to be able to supply he rson with the medicines that he requires.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood, and to bring electricity to her home.

loans.name: Balimaya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Balimaya II sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres, le pois de terre, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NASSOUN D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 3 hectare de pois de terre et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Balimaya II are married women who average 37 years of age and two children each. They live in polygamous families in Missiritou, a village in the Dioïla prefecture, in Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to better organize their activities at the start of winter. Their crops include ground peas, millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second farm loan, and the previous loan was repaid without problems. With this new loan, NASSOUN D. plans to buy inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for the plowing required to maintain 1.3 hectares of ground peas and peanuts. After harvest, the produce is sold in Dioïla to a clientele composed primarily of dealers from the big cities. They hope to make an average profit of approximately 50,000FCFA by end of season.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small farming equipment

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa nació en la ciudad de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente, Rosa vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus hijos. Hace 25 años Rosa que se dedica a la venta de helados “Donofrio”. Actualmente, Rosa tiene una puesto de venta en el mercado “Molino”, que esta modestamente equipado con congeladoras y neveras. La pueden encontrar los sábados y domingos en su puesto de venta, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, pero los días particulares se encuentra un ayudante. Rosa y su esposo también llevan y venden helados en las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, su esposo se encuentra en la feria de “Cocla” en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convención departamento del Cusco. Ya varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Rosa que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para alquilar otro puesto de venta en el mercado molino de la ciudad del Cusco.  

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Rosa es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios pusieron de nombre “Señor de Torrechayoc” a su banco comunal en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Urubamba, located 70 minutes from the city of Cusco. Today Rosa lives in Cusco together with her husband and their children. For the past 25 years Rosa has been selling Donofrio frozen treats. She has a stand in the Molino market that is modestly equipped with freezers and ice-cream servers. She is there on Saturdays and Sundays from 9 am to 5pm but on weekends she has hired help to run the stand. Rosa and her husband also go to the various fairs in Cusco. Her husband has gone to the Cocla fair in the city of Quillabamba. She has been running her business for many years now and she has found success thanks to the hard work she has invested. The loan requested is in the amount of S/.1500 nuevos soles. She would like to invest the loan funds to rent another stand in the Molino market in Cusco. In 1994 the community bank named The Man of Torrechayo was established and Rosa was one of the founding members. The members were all religious so they named the community bank after the patron saint of the city of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent another stand in the Molino market.

loans.name: Bassa Group

texts.en:
Martha G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Bassa Group. Martha is 54 years old, married and has four children who range from16 to 35 years old. She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. She cares for three grandchildren.

For 25 years, she has been selling fish in Whenn Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her dream is to grow her business and build a house. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Norah L. is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zoila Luz

texts.es:
Zoila nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos D. la ciudad D. Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos D. las cuales los tres son independientes. Zoila tiene 73 años y hace 40 años atrás abrió un restaurante en su domicilio, donD. sirve extras, desayunos, menú y otras cosas más. A pueden encontrar en su restaurante los 7 días D. las semana, desD. las 5 D. la mañana hasta tarD. en la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro D. comida.  Ya varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Livia que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero D. préstamo para ampliar su cocina.     

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor D. Torrechayoc”, pero Zoila es una D. las fundadoras D. banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios pusieron D. nombre “Señor D. Torrechayoc” a su banco comunal en homenaje al patrón jurado D. la ciudad D. Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Zoila was born in Urubamba, an 70 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She lives there still with her husband and their three children. All three children are now independent. Zoila is 73 years old and it was 40 years ago that she opened a restaurant in a section of her home. She serves snacks, breakfast, an a la carte menu and other prepared foods. She works 7 days a week from 5 in the morning until last at night, or until the food is sold out. It has been many years since she first started her business and it has been very successful thanks to her hard work. In 1994 the community bank named The Man of Torrechayo was established and Rosa was one of the founding members. The members were all religious so they named the community bank after the patron saint of the city of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her kitchen.

loans.name: La Esperanza I Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando y recibiendo las capacitaciones por parte de los asesores  dentro del segundo ciclo. 
Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades. 
 La Sra. Liz B. es una persona que se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo, a traer mercadería como ropas y productos no perecederos de Clorinda (Argentina) y al reciclado los fines de semana.
 En pocas palabras podemos decir que es un ejemplo para las demás integrante, ya que es una señora  muy luchadora y hace de todo para salir adelante.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como, remeras, buzos, pantalones, jeans, y productos no perecederos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
This group is currently on its second loan cycle. The group has demonstrated to be very responsible and all the members have their own business. Mrs. Liz B. runs various types of businesses, for example, she collects clothing and non-perishable food products from Clorinda, Argentina. She also collects items from the recycling depot on the weekends. In a few words, it can be said that she sets an example for the other members of the group because she is so hard working and she does everything to see success. She requests a loan to purchase clothing such as shirts, sweaters, slacks, jeans and other non-perishable food items such as rice, pasta, sugar, cooking oil and others.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchanidse.

loans.name: Balimaya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya III est constitué de sept femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le sésame, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
La production est  vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Balimaya III Group is made up of seven married women with an average age of 38 and 3 children, and most of them live in polygamous families in Missiritou, on of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow sesame, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second seasonal loan and their previous loan was fully repaid. With this new loan, Oumou T. hopes to buy fertilizer, small farming equipment, and pay the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1 hectare of peanuts. The harvested goods are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a client base composed of both men and women. They hope to make a profit of approximately 50,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment

loans.name: Edina

texts.es:
Edina vive en la zona de alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es soltera.
La cliente es empleada en una Limpieza y para mejorar sus ingresos decidió iniciar una actividad económica como la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, para lo cual solicita un crédito para comprar los productos.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva. El análisis socio-económico indica que ella es un sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Edina lives in the Alto Chijini region of the city of La Paz. She is single. She is an employee of a house cleaning company. To improve her income she would like to start up a business of her own such as the sales of cosmetics and perfumes, which is the reason for this loan. For the first time she is requesting a loan from Kiva. The socio-economic analysis indicates that she may access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and perfumes to start her own business.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es:
Domingo de 27 años de edad es casado, tiene 1 hija de 18 meses de edad, trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años, desempeñandose como ayudante de albañil. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de comenzar a construir los arranques para su casita, ya que desea irla construyendo poco a poco, pues quiere darle a su pequeñita las comodidades que esten a su alcance.  

El mayor sueño de Domingo es poder terminar su casa con las condiciones basicas para su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo is 27 years old and he is married. He has an 18-month old baby girl. He has worked for the city hall of Juigalpa for the past 2 years, working as an assistant laborer. He requests a loan to start building a little house of their own. He wants to build it a small step at a time. He wants to provide his baby girl with all the comforts of home. Domingo’s greatest dream is to finish building his house with all the basic services for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start building a house.

loans.name: Balimaya  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Balimaya IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare de haricot et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Balimaya IV group are married women who average 35 years of age and 2 children each. Most live in polygamous families in Missiritou, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown are, among others, pearl millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second planting loan and the preceding loan has been fully repaid. With this new loan, DJENEBA T. plans to pay for planting supplies, small tools and labor costs to maintain around 1.2 hectares of beans and peanuts. The crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers. They expect to make a profit of approximately 45,000 CFA at the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, planting supplies and small tools

loans.name: Gabino Antonio

texts.es:
Gabino de 32 años de edad es soltero, no tiene hijos, trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año, desempeñandose como ayudante de albañil. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en la casa de su papá, para asi contar con mayor privacidad y poder teniendo condiciones para cuando forme su propia familia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener su casa con las mejores condiciones y estudiar.
texts.en:
Gabino is 32 years old and he is single with no kids. He has worked in the city hall of Juigalpa for the past year as an assistant laborer. He requests a loan with the plan of building a room of his own, in his father’s house. He hopes to gain some privacy and to be ready for a family of his own. His greatest dream is to have a house with better living conditions, and he dreams of going to school.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Alvaro de 33 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Alba M. con quien tiene 2 niños: Noel de 14 años estudiando 2do año de secundaria y Anielka de 11 años en 3er grado de primaria. Alvaro  trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año, desempeñandose como ayudante de albañil. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de embaldozar la sala de su casa que actualmente es de suelo, pues con las lluvias se le hace lodo en una parte, y desea evitar cualquier enfermedad a su familia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y poder brindarles las mejores condiciones posibles en el hogar.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 33, is single and lives in common-law union with Alba M. with whom he has two children: Noel, 14, who’s in second year of secondary school and Anielka, 11, in third grade of elementary school. He’s been employed by the city of Juigalpa as a bricklayer’s helper for the last year. He is requesting his first loan in order to install stone flooring in his house because the floors are currently dirt and when it rains part of it becomes mud and he wants to prevent any illness for his family. His greatest wish is to see his children become professionals and to provide them with the best possible conditions in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install stone flooring in his house.

loans.name: Wadakiétou

texts.fr: K. est une femme mariée, elle est mère de 2 enfants et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, plus tard elle y associé la vente de maïs. elle exerce son activité à la devanture de sa maison, la majorité de ses clients sont des habitants de son quartier. elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 30 sacs de charbons de bois et 15 sacs de maïs. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la localité de WAHALA.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a married mother of two who sells charcoal for a living. She has sold charcoal since 2000, and later on she began selling corn. She sells these items in front of her house and the majority of her customers are from her neighborhood. She is requesting her first loan through WAGES so she can increase her stock with the purchase of 30 sacks of charcoal and 15 sacks of corn. She buys her stock in the inland locality of Wahala.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Hector Javier

texts.es:
Hector de 44 años de edad es casado, trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 17 años, desempeñandose como tecnico urbanistico. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de reparar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se moja parte de su casa.  

Su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa con las condiciones necesarias para su familia.
texts.en:
Hector is 44 years old and he is married. He has worked at the city hall of Juigalpa for the past 17 years as an urban planner. He is requesting his sixth loan with the plan of repairing the roof of his house. The rainy season is soon to come and the roof leaks and floods his house. His greatest dream is to have a house that is equipped to meet the basic needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with two grown-up children. She owns a small bakery located in a village close to Ivano-Frankovsk city. Ten years ago she lost her job of  pastry-cook because the company she worked for closed. Vera decided to start working on her own. 

Vera was able to purchase an old building and make it a bakery. Absence of competitors enabled Vera's business to grow fast. Still she owns the only bakery in this village. This is a family business that brings a stable income.

Vera would like to borrow 6,500 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) to purchase 650 kg of sugar. He will use it in her bakery for several months.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for baking

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora de 42 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Domingo Tablada con quien tiene una niña de 2 añitos llamada Noa Massiel.  Nora es docente de profesion, pero actualmente esta trabajando como administradora del cafetin de la Escuela Leopoldina Castrillo desde hace 3 años, ademas se dedica a comercializar cosmeticos y tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion. 

Esta solicitando  su 11vo credito con el objetivo de reparar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se moja parte de su casa ademas ponerle la ceramica a la sala y al cuarto.  

En el credito anterior fue benefiado con el fondo kiva, logrando satisfactoriamente terminar la construccion del cuarto.  Expresa que se siente muy agradecida con AFODENIC, pues es gracias a los creditos que le han financiado que ahora tiene su casita bonita y con algunas condiciones para su hijita.
texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married to Mr. Domingo Tablada. They have a 2 year old daughter named Noa Massiel. Nora is a teacher by profession, but has been working as the administrator of the school cafeteria at the Leopoldina Castrillo School for 3 years. In addition, she sells cosmetics and has a small grocery store in her house. She is asking for her 11th loan to repair the roof of her house, which leaks water into the house when it rains, and also to install ceramic floor tile in her living room and bedroom. Nora received a previous loan from Kiva which allowed her to finish building her bedroom. She is grateful to AFODENIC, and thanks to the loans that they have financed, she now has a beautiful upgraded house for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof and tile the floor

loans.name: Nadiétou

texts.fr: F. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de tissus de haute qualité appelé BAZIN. elle s'approvisionne au niger. le bazin est un tissu très apprécié par les femmes togolaises. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2008 et le fait de façon ambulante. son stock de marchandises est en baisse c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour rehausser son stock avec une quinzaine de bazin et assurer le transport aller retour. elle est célibataire et c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. F. sells high quality fabric known as bazin. She buys her stock in Niger. Bazin is a fabric that is renowned among Togolese women. She has sold bazin since 2008 as an itinerant vendor. Her stock is currently low and she is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can purchase 15 pieces of bazin and transport them back home. She is unmarried and she uses the money earned from her business to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bazin

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
El Señor Wilder A. V., es soltero y trabaja para ayudar a su padre ya que él es el mayor de sus hijos, el es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja diariamente con su motocicleta para ayudar de alguna manera a sus hermanos y su padre. Wilder vive en el Trópico de la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona conocida como Ivirgarzama.

El aun no cuenta con vehículo (motocicleta) propio para generar ingresos. El señor Wilder Alcázar  se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder cumplir las metas que él tiene. Y poder tener una parcela agrícola propia para así poder cultivar cítricos al igual que su padre y en un futuro más cercano tener una familia con todas las comodidades que él no pudo tener.

El mayor sueño que tiene es darle a su padre todo lo que pueda y de esa manera pueda vivir el resto de su vida feliz y cómodo.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilder Alcázar V. is single and works to help his father since he’s the oldest of his sons. He is a young man who is very dedicated to his work. He works every day with his motorcycle in order to help his father and siblings in some way. Wilder lives Cochabamba’s Trópico area in a zone known as Ivirgarzama. He still doesn’t own his motorcycle with which to generate income. Mr. Wilder Alcázar came by the offices personally to request a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to reach his goals. He also wants to have a field to grow citrus fruits like his father and in the near future have a family with all the comforts he wasn’t able to have. His greatest wish is to give his father everything possible so that he can live the rest of his life happy and comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia de 49 años de edad es casada, vive cerca de la comarca de Cuapa junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo el Sr. Jose Perez y sus 3 hijos: Onelia de 28 años que trabaja y apoya con los gastos de la casa, Runel de 24 años que tiene limitaciones para caminar y esta bajo su cuidado y la Menor de 21 años de nombre Melba que actualmente esta estudiando un curso de secretariado ejecutivo con la esperanza de conseguir un trabajo que le permita apoyar a su familia con los gastos.  Lidia trabaja para EL MINED como docente de primaria desde hace 15 años.

Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa, como es reparar la pared del cuarto y la cocina que se encuentran en mal estado y si el dinero lo permite reparar parte del techo que esta dañado.  

El mayor sueño de lidia es poder brindarle a su familia las condiciones basicas para que se sientan comodos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 49 years old. She is married and lives in the Cuapa hamlet with her family, comprised of her husband, Jose Perez, and her three children: Onelia, age 28 who works and helps with household expenses; Runel, age 24 who has walking disabilities and is under their care; and the youngest, Melba, age 21 who is taking an executive secretary course in hopes of getting a job where she can help support the family with its expenses. Lidia has worked for the past 15 years as an elementary school teacher for “El Mined.” She is asking for her 8th loan in so that she can make some improvements to her home, such as repairing an inside wall and the kitchen, which is in bad shape. If there is enough money, she will also repair part of the roof, which is damaged. Lidia’s greatest dream is to give her family the basic living conditions, so that they will be comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi I est constitué de dix femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  43 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames à Ladjibougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Elles cultivent le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU C. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 3 hectare de riz et de petit mil.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Les membres du groupe  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA environ  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi I is made up of ten married women who are around 43 years old and have three children and live in polygamous families in Ladjibougou, a village in the Dioïla municipality, in the Koulikoro region, the second largest region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association with the aim of better organising their businesses at the beginning of the crop wintering season. They cultivate rice, millet, peanuts and beans. They are on their second loan and successfully repaid their first. With the new loan OUMOU C. aims to purchase seeds and small tools as well as paying the labour costs to manage around 1 to 3 hectars of rice and millet. The crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a customer base made up of men and women. They envisage generating a profit of around 35,000FCFA.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour costs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes de este comité están muy satisfechas con los trabajos que vienen realizando y se encuentran en un periodo de afianzamiento del grupo ya que están dentro del primer ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Licia quien se dedica a la venta de calzados deportivos que ella importa de la Argentina.
Ella viaja cada mes y trae las mercaderías solicitadas por los clientes.
Licia ofrece mercaderías de buena calidad y facilita el pago otorgando los calzados y otras mercaderías a cuotas accesibles, así ella cuenta con muchos clientes y logra obtener ingreso que le ayuda en su hogar. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de nuevos modelos de calzados deportivos.
 Ella dice que si uno se propone metas todo ese puede lograr con un poco de sacrificio.
texts.en:
All of the members of this committee are very satisfied with the work each is doing and are in a group financing period since they are within the first cycle. One of the group members is Licia who sells athletic shoes that she imports from Argentina. She travels each month to bring the merchandise that her customers request. Licia offers good quality goods and easy payment plans for the shoes and other merchandise. Thus she has many regular customers and earns income that helps her support her household. The loan she is requesting is to buy new models of athletic shoes. She says that if one sets goals everything is possible with a bit of sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes.

loans.name: Beka

texts.fr: cette dame est âgée de 38 ans, elle est très dynamique et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006. elle son commerce à son domicile situé dans le quartier d'agoè logopé. le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients. elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 20 sacs de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays plus précisément dans la localité d'anié.
texts.en:
Ms. B. is 38 years old, she is very active and sells sacks of charcoal for a living. She has been doing so since 2006. She sells her charcoal at her house located in the Agoè Logopé neighborhood. Her stock is currently insufficient to meet the demands of her customers. She wants to purchase more stock and she is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can purchase 20 sacks of charcoal. She buys her stock in the inland locality of Anié.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan José tiene 54 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de chatarra Decidido a empezar una vida, Juan utilizo sus ahorros para empezar este negocio desde más de 7 años se dedica a este negocio, el tiene un excelente servicio, razón por la cual le dedica más empeño y dedicación todos los días Con este crédito que es el primero quiere comprar  llantas, repuestos para la camioneta y mas chatarra. El se siente muy contento pues quiere salir adelante para mejorar sus ingresos. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda y obtener otro carro.
texts.en:
Juan José, 54, buys and sells scrap. Determined to start a new life he started this business 7 years ago. He provides excellent service for which he must put in more work and dedication every day. This is his first loan and he plans to use the funds to buy tires, vehicle replacement parts and more scrap. He is happy because he wants to get ahead and improve his income. He dreams with finishing building his house and with getting another car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, vehicle replacement parts and more recyclables.

loans.name: Alex Ignacio

texts.es:
Alex de 35 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, el tiene una panadería/tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, su esposa le ayuda en la tienda mientras que el hace los panes para la panadería, tienen tres hijos de 14, 9 y 4 años. 

Antes de tener su negocio el trabajaba en el aeropuerto pero como lo despidieron no tuvo opción que gastar sus ahorros e invertirlos en harina, y readecuo su casa para ubicar un pequeño local, poco a poco haciendo panes, pudo comprar víveres. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.10 centavos, trabajan desde la madrugada con su esposa. 

El quiere readecuar su negocio y su casa para tener mas espacio para el loca con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pinturas. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con exito y tener su negocio mas surtido.
texts.en:
Alex, 35, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. He has a bakery/store in the front of his house. His wife helps him tend to the store while he bakes the bread for the bakery. They have three children who are 14, 9 and 4 years of age. Prior to having his own business he worked at the airport but when he was let go he had no other option but to spend his savings on flour and rearrange his house to set up a small locale. Little by little baking bread he was able to buy food. He sells each roll for $0.10 cents. He and his wife start working at dawn. He wants to rearrange his store and his house in order to have more room for the store. He will use the loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and paint. In the future, he’d like his children to successfully complete their education and to have a better stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, concrete blocks and paint.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Ladjibougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les membres du groupe cultivent sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MARIAM D., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 4 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues essentiellement au niveau de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de commerçants.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA environ en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Benkadi II are married women who average 38 years of age and four children each. They live in polygamous families in Ladjibougou, a village in the Dioïla prefecture, in Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to better organize their activities at the start of winter. Their crops include rice, millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second farm loan, and the previous loan was repaid without incident. With this new loan, MARIAM D., president of the group, plans to buy inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for the plowing required to maintain 1.4 hectares of rice and peanuts. After harvest, the produce is sold primarily in Massigui to a clientele consisting of merchants. By end of season, they hope to make a profit of approximately 45,000FCFA.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for plowing, inputs and small farming equipment

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora Eustaquia C. Fernández vive con su hija Teresa Miranda Caraballo que tiene 30 años de edad en Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Alto San Isidro hacia el norte, La señora tiene 58 años de edad es viuda hace un año atrás, de tal modo se quedo sola con su única hija.

La señora Eustaquia y su hija Se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca y papaliza aparte de realizar el cuidado de sus animales; La señora Eustaquia y su hija se apersono a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas compra de productos agroquímicos, que nos comenta con este crédito salir adelante mejorando su producción agrícola sembrar en mas superficies y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eustaquia C. Fernández, 58, lives with her daughter, Teresa Miranda Caraballo, 30, in Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Alto San Isidro, towards the north. She was widowed a year ago so is now alone with her only daughter. Eustaquia and her daughter farm potatoes, broad beans, oca and papalisa (Andean tubers) and care for their farm animals. Eustaquia and her daughter came in person to our offices to request funds to buy chicken manure and other chemical farm supplies. She commented that with this loan she intends to improve her farm production and plant larger surface areas thus improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi III est composé par huit femmes mariées ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, en moyenne   enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Ladjibougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NANA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioîla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi III is a group of eight married women, who are on average 27 years old and mainly live in polygamous families in Ladjibougou, one of the villages of the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, 2nd Administrative Region of Mali. They have been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities leading in to the lean season. They speculate in rice, millet, groundnut and beans, among others. This is their second group loan; the first was repaid on time. With this new loan, Nana D. plans to buy supplies and small equipment and to pay labour costs for the maintenance of about 1 hectare of millet and groundnut. The harvest will be sold in the cities of Dioîla and Massigui to a clientele of men and women. They expect to earn an average income of 45,000 francs per season.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, supplies and small equipment

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria Elizabeth de 41 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia tiene 3 hijos pero solamente 2 están a su cargo. Hace  más de 24 años se dedica en la compra y venta de ropa. Este negocio lo realiza en las calles y en su vivienda como sus vecinos conocen el negocio que realiza, no dudan en llegar para hacerle algún pedido y más aún son los fines de semana es cuando vende en mayor cantidad. Atiende hasta altas horas de la noche y disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza. Este es su primer crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes.
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeth, age 41, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house, and she has three children. Only two of them are under her care. She has been buying and selling clothes for over 24 years. She conducts her business on the street and at home. Some of her neighbors know about her business, and they do not hesitate to order from her. The week-ends are when she sells the most. She sees to her business until late at night, and she really enjoys her work. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and other clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Ladjibougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs  1 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
KADIATOU compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi IV group are married women with an average age of 34 and an average of 3 children. For the most part, they live in polygamous families in Ladjibougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second seasonal loan and have repaid their previous loan in full. With this new loan, Kadiatou D. plans on buying fertilizer, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1 hectare of peanuts. The harvested goods are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a client base made up of both men and women. Kadiatou hopes to make a profit of approximately 20,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Néfissa

texts.fr: M. néfissa  est une femme de 48 ans,elle est une dame très dynamique. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tubercules d'ignames. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la localité d'anié. elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce; sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle est en rupture de stock et n'arrive donc plus à satisfaire tous ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de vingt tas de tubercules d'ignames pour rehausser son stock. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Néfissa M., 48 years old, is a very dynamic lady. She makes a living selling yam tubers. She gets her stocks in the inland locality of Anié. She has been doing this for five years, and her customer base includes anyone. Her stocks are currently depleted and she can no longer meet customer demand. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase twenty heaps of yam tubers to increase her stocks. She is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yam tubers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cinnamon, flour, cooking oil, firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Smoking and selling fish

loans.name: By God’S Grace Group

texts.en:
Esther T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called By God’s Grace. Esther is 50 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 16 to 30 years old. She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. She cares for three siblings.

For 7 years, she has been selling lappas (a traditional dress for women) in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 55,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of lappas. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her dream is to improve her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Bob T. is inset at the lower right because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of lappas

loans.name: Sélifatou

texts.fr: A. est une dame de 37 ans qui est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'agoè anomé. elle  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques. elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 5 ans et maîtrise donc tous le contour de ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne au ghana voisin. son stock de marchandises est en baisse. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers ustensiles de cuisine afin de rehausser son stock.
texts.en:
Sélifatou A. is 37 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She lives with her family in the Agoè Anomé district. Her line of business is selling plastic kitchenware. She has been doing this for more than 5 years and thus is experienced in all aspects of this business. She gets her supplies in neighboring Ghana and her stock of merchandise is low. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy an assortment of kitchenware in order to replenish her stock.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic kitchenware

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of pepper

loans.name: Djekafo I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo I est  constitués de dix femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 42 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Dramanebougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KONIMBA T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla  ou Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de commerçants. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Djekafo I group is made up of 10 married women with an average age of 42, an average of 4 children, and they live for the most part in polygamous families in Dramanebougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow, among other crops, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their third seasonal loan and all their previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Konimba T. plans on buying fertilizer, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1.5 hectares of pearl millet and peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a client base made up of consumers and shopkeepers. She hopes to make a profit of approximately 45,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Alma Norma

texts.es: Alma Norma M. desde hace un año cuenta con su negocio de Abarrotes llamado “Nahomi”, mismo que tiene en su misma casa para poder estar al tanto de sus 3 hijas para brindarles mas atención. Su esposo trabaja como empleado de trasportes; para llevar gente a las maquiladoras, entre los dos suplen los gastos. Alma desea surtir más su negocio para seguir generando ganancias y así ofrecer a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma Norma M. has had her grocery business, which is called “Nahomi”, for one year. It is located in her house so that she is able to give her three daughters more attention. Her husband works as a transportation employee, and he takes people to the factories. Between the two of them they cover the expenses. Alma wants to stock her business more in order to keep generating income. That way she will give her daughters a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es: Nora Del Carmen tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Ella dio inicio por que anteriormente se dedicaba a vender pozol y tiste y con el paso del tiempo y ciertas ganancias decide empezar a poner ciertos productos, que son necesarios para el hogar y con sus mismos vecinos que llegan a comprar lo que ofrece. Sueña con ampliar cada día más su negocio y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para la compra golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Nora Del Carmen, 57, has had a grocery store for over three years. She is always seeking ways to generate funds for her family. She used to sell pozol and tiste (typical corn-based drinks). As she started to earn income she used some of her profits to include other items that are of home use and that her neighbors come by to purchase. She dreams with enlarging her store every day and to be able to make some home improvements. The financing is to buy stock items like: sweets, natural beverages, bread, cookies, detergents and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Djekafo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djekafo II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Dramanebougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA T., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA environ en fin de   campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djekafo II group are married women who are on average 43 years old with 4 children. Most live in polygamous families in Dramanebougou, one of the villages of the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, 2nd Administrative Region of Mali. They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities leading in to the lean season. They speculate in millet, groundnut and beans. They are on their third group loan; previous loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, Djeneba T., the President of the group, plans to buy supplies, small equipment and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1.3 hectares of millet and groundnut. The harvest will be sold in the cities of Dioïla and Massigui to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn about 40,000 francs income by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Ma. Del Refugio

texts.es: Ma. Del Refugio H. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años donde ofrece zapatos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos en muy buenas condiciones y a un bajo precio. La señora quiere surtir su negocio para tener mas variedad de tallas y colores para ofrecer a sus clientes mejor servicio. Su esposo es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre apoya a su esposa en todos sus proyectos.
texts.en:
María Del Refugio H. has been selling used clothes for four years. She sells shoes, blouses, skirts, pants and dresses. The clothes are in very good condition and at a low price. She wants to stock her business in order to have a greater variety of sizes and colors. She wants to do this so that she can offer her customers better service. Her husband is a very hard-working man who always supports his wife in all of her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Djekafo  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo III est  constitué par six femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles polygames à Dramanebougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide, le sésame, le pois de terre et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SELIMATA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de sésame et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The Djekafo III group is made up of six married women with an average age of 38, 3 children, and they live in polygamous families in Dramanebougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow, among other crops, pearl millet, peanuts, sesame, peas, and beans. They are on their third seasonal loan and all of their previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Selimata D. plans on buying fertilizer, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1 hectare of sesame and peanuts. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla to a client base made up of merchants. She hopes to make a profit of approximately 50,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Royah Group

texts.en:
Lawou M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Royah. Lawou is 48 years old, married and has six children who range from 8 to 27 years old. She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. 

For 16 years, she has been selling lappas (a traditional dress for women) in the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cartons of lappas. She describes herself as an easy-going woman. 

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie S. is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more lappas (dresses) for resale

loans.name: God Blessing #2 Group

texts.en:
