Tamey Q., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Blessing #2. Tamey is 34 years old, single, and has three children who range from 6 to 18 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to a lack of financial support. She cares for two siblings.

For 6 years, she has been operating a tailoring shop in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 34,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cloth.

She describes herself as a quiet person.

Her goal is to improve her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, William F. is inset because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy phone cards and add some money to his business

loans.name: Essi Akpéné

texts.fr: A., est une femme célibataire de 31 ans, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins elle s'est lancée dans la restauration, son restaurant s'appelle " MAQUIS LA PROVIDENCE". elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. elle a ouvert son restaurant depuis 2006. les matières nécessaires à son activité de restauration sont épuisées, elle demande son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile, 15 casiers de boissons et divers autres produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
Essi Akpéné A. is a 31 year-old unmarried woman. She went into the restaurant business to support herself. Her restaurant is called “MAQUIS LA PROVIDENCE.” She gets her supplies at Lomé’s large market. She opened her restaurant in 2006. She has run out of the supplies that she needs for her restaurant business. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 5 bags of corn, 5 sacks of rice, 2 drums of oil, 15 cases of drinks and varous other products necessary for her restaurant business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks and products necessary for the restaurant business

loans.name: Sayda Patricia

texts.es: Sayda Patricia tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia, sus dos hijos que son menores de edad. Hace más de 15 años trabaja vendiendo ropa, la modalidad de venta lo realiza visitando a sus clientes, y luego de un tiempo se dispone a realizar las cobranzas de su producto ya que tiene su propia tienda en donde llegan algunos clientes, vecinos y familiares. Este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella viaja a diferentes departamentos para adquirir variedad de prendas de vestir, en diversos colores y diseños que sean atractivos para su clientela, que en su mayoría es público femenino. Es su primer crédito y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sayda Patricia, 30, lives with her husband and two minor children in her own home. She has sold clothes for over 15 years. She visits her customers to sell items and gives them a period of time to pay since she has her own store where some customers, neighbors and relatives come by. This work is her main source of income. She travels to various departments to acquire items of clothing in a variety of colors and styles that will be attractive to her customers which are mostly women. This is her first loan and she pledges to be very punctual with repayments. She will use the requested funds to buy a larger amount of clothing thus increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Virginia Veronica

texts.es:
Virginia de 27 años, ella tiene una lavandería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales). Tienen con su esposo tres hijos de 10,9 años y uno de 3 meses. 

Ella hace tres años comenzó con su negocio de lavanderia por la falta de oportunidades y ayudar con los gastos familiares, inicio con una lavadora trabajando hasta la noche, poco a poco con ayuda de su esposo pudo comprar mas lavadoras y readecuar el local. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una lavadora y detergente para su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener secadoras para dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Virginia, 27, has a laundry in front of her house. She lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. Most of its residents are informal merchants. She and her husband are parents of three children who are 10 and 9 years old; the baby is 3 months old. Three years ago she started her laundry business because of the lack of employment opportunities and her desire to contribute to household expenses. She started with the laundry working until late at night. Gradually with her husband’s help she was able to buy more washing machines and refurbish her locale. She wants to use the loan to buy a washing machine and detergent for the business. In the future, she’d like to have dryers in order to provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a washing machine and detergent.

loans.name: Balakiyem

texts.fr: cette dame est âgée de 40 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de détail de tissus; elle fait ce commerce depuis 2 ans déjà. elle y a associé le commerce de sacs de sortie de femmes et  exerce son activité de façon ambulante. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. son stock est en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  une vingtaine de tissus et 11 sacs de sortie de femmes.
texts.en:
Balakiyem A. is 40 years old, and for the last two years she has made her living through the itinerant retail sale of fabric and women’s purses. She buys her supplies in Lomé’s large market. Her stock is low, and she is requesting a loan through WAGES to buy 20 pieces of fabric and 11 purses.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics and women's purses

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian, de 38 años de edad, es padre soltero y tiene 3 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, específicamente en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, donde tiene su propio techo a base de adobe. Desde su adolescencia tenia ese sueño de estudiar la carrera de ingeniería civil, pero por cosas del destino no pudo cumplir su sueño, debido a la economía precaria que existía en su familia, no obstante siguió con su rutina diaria, trabajando en la chacra de sus  padres. Después de un largo tiempo Adrian, retomó sus propias decisiones para incursionar en un nuevo proyecto, específicamente cultivando y comercializando producto de cacao, desde luego que a inicios le fue difícil, pero con el tiempo logró posicionarse. En la actualidad su producto lo vende a otras localidades, por lo que recibe buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones que le ayudan a facilitar la extracción de su producto final, en el que luego son vendidos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su grupo comunal, debido a que todos son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con al finalidad de que le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Adrian, 38, is a single father; he has three school age children. They all live together in the beautiful Cusco backcountry, specifically in Villa Quintiarina, where he owns his own adobe dwelling. When he was an adolescent he wanted to study Civil Engineering but destiny prevented him from doing so due to his family’s precarious financial situation. Notwithstanding, he continued with his daily routine working his parents’ farmlands. After a long time, Adrian retook control of his own decisions and entered into a new project, specifically farming cacao beans. Of course, it was difficult at first but in time he managed to stabilize. Now he sells his product in other locations thereby obtaining good economic results. Usually he works alone and sometimes gets help from his children. During harvest, however, he employs two laborers that help him reap his final product that’s later sold to his community’s crop gathering center. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he pledges to continue to repay in a timely manner. He is happy with his communal group because all of the members are punctual with their repayments. He will use the requested funds to buy supplies and manure aimed at giving his crops proper care and maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
NELLY SE CASO A LOS 17 AÑOS, NO TENIA NINGUN ESTUDIO Y FUE SU ESPOSO QUIEN LE DIO LA CARRERA TECNICA D. CORTE Y CONFECCION, ERA UN POKO DIFICIL AL PRINCIPIO PORQUE TENIA QUE CRIAR A SU HIJO D. UN AÑO, SIEMPRE QUIZO TRABAJAR D. UNA MANERA INDEPENDIENTE,FUE UNA AMIGA QUIEN LA MOTIVO PARA QUE NELLY ALQUILARA UN PUESTO EN UN LUGAR CENTRICO PARA PROVEER UN INGRESO ADICIONAL, Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA, PARA ELLO SU ESPOSO LE COMPRO SU PRIMERA MAQUINA D. COCER (RECTA SIMPLE), QUE TIENE HASTA AHORA D. RECUERDO. NELLY EMPEZO CONFECCIONANDO VESTIDOS, FALDAS; SUS VECINOS SABIAN QUE ERA COSTURERA, Y FUERON ELLOS QUIENES RECOMENDABAN A SUS AMISTADES, POR EL SERVICIO QUE ESTA SEÑORA, ASI FUE INCREMENTANDO SUS INGRESOS, POCO A POCO, TERMINÒ ESTUDIAR SU CARRERA Y ENTONCES EMPEZO A COMPRAR CON EL TIEMPO MAS TELAS E HILOS, CON LOS PRESTAMOS QUE RECIBIO,TUVO LA OPORTUNIDAD D. HACERSE CONOCIDA EN LOS COLEGIOS A LOS CUALES LES CONFECCIONABA EL UNIFORME A LOS PROFESORES, PERO LE ERA UTIL ADQUIRIR UNA REMALLADORA, ES ASI QUE ACUD. A EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, Y SOLICITA UN CREDITO PARA OBTENER LA MAQUINA; LE FUE BIEN EN SUS VENTAS QUE CON EL TIEMPO EMPEZO A CONFECCIONAR VESTIDOS D. NOVIA, COMPROMISOS PARA EVENTOS SOCIALES.DOND. LE GENERABA DEMANDA D. INGRESOS, SUPO ADMINISTRAR SU NEGOCIO QUE LLEVÒ ADQUIRIR MAS MAQUINAS, LOS INGRESOS D. ESTE NEGOCIO LE SIRVIERON PARA EDUCAR A SUS TRES HIJOS, QUIENES SON PROFESIONALES EN LA ACTUALIDAD, ADEMAS COMPRO UN PUESTO PROPIO EN UN LUGAR CENTRICO, ACTUALMENTE YA NO OFRECE SUS SERVICIOS A INSTITUCIONES PRIVADAS PORQUE LE VA BIEN EN SU NEGOCIO.
LO QUE AHORA LE GENERA SUS INGRESOS ES PARA ELLA, SU ESPOSO Y SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS NIETOS. EL CREDITO QUE NECESITA NELLY ES PARA COMPRAR TELAS PORQUE TIENE PEDIDOS D. VESTIDOS, POR ANIVERSARIO PATRIO DEL PERU. TRABAJAR D. ESTA MANERA LE HACE SENTIR BIEN HABER REALIZADO MUCHAS D. SUS METAS Y SEGUIR APOYANDO A SU FAMILIA EN EL NEGOCIO QUE LE GUSTA COMO ES LA CONFECCION.
texts.en:
Nelly got married at age 17. She didn’t have a formal education and it was her husband who taught her how to sew and manufacture clothing. It was a bit of a challenge at first, because she also had to care for her one year old son. She has always wanted to work on her own and it was a friend who encouraged her to lease a workshop in a central location. This allowed her to earn additional income and improve her quality of life. Her husband bought her first sewing machine (basic), which she still keeps as a memento. Nelly began making dresses and skirts. Her neighbors knew that she was a seamstress and it was they who recommended her services to their friends. She began to increase her income little by little, completed her studies, and over time began buying more fabrics and thread with the loans she received. She had the opportunity to become well known in the various schools, where she maD. uniforms for teachers, but it became necessary for her to acquire a chain stitch sewing machine. For this reason she approached Edaprospo-Prosperidad to request a loan in order to buy the machine. Things went well for her and she began making wedding gowns and formals. This generated additional income for her. She did a good job managing her business and was able to buy more machines and the income provided her the means with which to pay for her three children’s education. They have all achieved professional careers. She was also able to buy her own workshop in a central location and no longer offers her services to private institutions because her business is doing very well. The income she now earns is for herself and for her husband, and to treat her grandchildren. Nelly will use the money from this loan to buy fabric because she has orders for dresses for the Peruvian Independence Day. It makes her feel good to have achieved most of her goals and to continue to be able to support her family by running the business she enjoys; dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 70-year-old father who lives with his wife and son,  in Montes de Oca, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Rodrigo runs a nursery where he sells various plants and small trees which bear fruit. His customers purchase decorative plants as well as fruit-producing plants such as banana and squash. He plans to use this loan to increase his productive output, in other words, the number of plants in his salable inventory.

Rodrigo will use this loan to invest in the construction of two new greenhouses. Specifically, this loan will help to finance the creation of irrigation systems, the purchase of tubing, seeds, nutrients and other inputs necessary to the production of plants. 

Rodrigo is a busy entrepreneur; as a result, he must organize his day efficiently. In the mornings and the afternoons he dedicates a few hours to his nursery. Nursery tasks include planning, planting, watering and preparing pots, among others.  

At his age, Rodrigo still dreams. He hopes to increase his income in order to be able to manage costs (schooling costs of his grandson, rent on the land occupied by the nursery) with more ease. Rodrigo´s main obstacle is a lack of access to working capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to offer a greater variety of plants, of superior condition and in better quality pots.

loans.use: To finance the construction of two greenhouses and other inputs necessary to plant production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cow skin

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 37 years old.  He is married, and has 2 children, aged 15 and 12, both in school. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him because he needs help due to pressure from customers, as sales attendants.  In 2005, Musa established his drinks and provision business. He began his business because he did not go to school, so he started business as to change his life and family history of poverty.  

Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about 1,391,800 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 SLL. Musa requires a loan in order to improve his stock and to increase his wife's business capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 347,950 SLL.  In the future, Musa plans to educate his children all the way through school since he did not go to school.  He also plans to service the remote community with a larger customer base.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Renacer Ii Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando en dentro del cuarto ciclo y se encuentran recibiendo la capacitación de los asesores sobre como trabajar en equipo y las ventajas del mismo que se desarrolla en el 4° ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Luisa B. con 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender sus mercaderías (braceros: recipiente de metal usado para hacer fuego de carbón) por la mañana en la zona de Lambaré este trabajo lo realiza todas las mañanas, luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su venta. 
Es una señora muy sacrificada que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de  aluminio para la fabricación de braceros, la fabricación lo realiza su marido quien es herrero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is working in their fourth cycle. They are receiving training from counselors on how to work as a team and the advantages of working as a team. The training takes place during the fourth cycle. Luisa B., age 45, is one of the members. She has two children, and they stay at home while she leaves to sell her merchandise (“braseros”: containers used to burn coals to heat houses). Every morning she sells in the Lambaré area. She later returns home to prepare lunch. She leaves again in the afternoon to sell. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who has a tedious daily work schedule. Upon arriving home from work she needs to do the housework. Everything she does is to get her family ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy aluminum to make the braseros. Her husband, a blacksmith, makes them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aluminum

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El Sr Sabino N. Fernández es casado, tiene 3 hijos uno de 10, 7 y de 5 años, vive en zona rural Comunidad Huancuni de Colomi provincia Chapare Cochabamba.

El Sr. Sabino se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, tuberculos que se cultivan en esa zona, que después de la cosecha lleva a vender en la feria semanal de Colomi, Es así que logra percibir un ingreso económico anual para mantener a su familia además tiene 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno que lo utiliza en las faenas agrícolas así para economizar sus ingresos, El Sr. Sabino trabaja solo con su esposa la Sra. Sayda Galarza.

El Sr. Sabino se apersono a la oficina para solicitar un crédito, para compra de semilla de papa, haba y productos agroquímicos, aprovechar que es época de poder comprar a precios accesibles porque le sobro parcelas preparadas, de este modo sembrar en más superficies y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para el siguiente año que biene.
texts.en:
Sr. Sabino N. F. is married and has 3 children who are 10, 7 and 5 years old. He lives in a rural area of the Bolivian province of Chapare Cochabamba. Sr. Sabino is a farmer. He grows potatoes, beans, oca and other crops that are common here. He sells his crop at a market in nearby Colomi and the income from the sales is how he supports his family. He also has 3 head of cattle that he uses on the farm. His wife, Sra. Sayda Galarza, is his only helper. Sr. Sabino approached the bank to apply for a loan that he will use to buy seeds and agrochemicals for the farm. He wants to make the most of the season because seed prices are relatively low. He has some land that has been prepared for planting so he'll be able to grow more crops and improve his income in the coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Festus.  He is married, and has 2 children, aged 7 and 4. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because his parents believe Festus can help with his education. 

Festus established his pharmaceutical drugs business in 2001. He began his business because he was working before but deemed it fit and profitable if he started his own business.  In the rains many people fall ill, so that is the time he makes more money. He works 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, and he earns about 941,600 SLL every month from this business. 

Fetus has a very good loan repayment history.  He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Festus needs a loan in order to increase stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 141,240 SLL. In the future, Festus plans to increase stock in a way that could lead to an established pharmacy that could cater for all categories of people. Fetus’s pharmaceutical drugs business services the remote community with a large customer base.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El Sr Marcelino López Jiménez es conviviente con la señora Basilia Castellón Higuera hace 25 años atrás, tienen 5 hijos dependientes que estudian, viven en Segunda Candelaria Central Kury Mayu zona rural Colomi.

El Sr. Marcelino y su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, el cultivo de tuberculos, como papa, de donde perciben ingresos anuales, cosecha y comercializa en los días de feria de Colomi, Es así que logra mantener a su familia económicamente también abastecer para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales.

El Sr. Marcelino está solicitando préstamo a CIDRE, para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y un ganado vacuno, con esto velar los intereses de estudio de sus hijos, de este modo sembrar en mas superficies y tener mayor movimiento económico en bien de su familia durante el año, seguridad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino L. Jimenez and his partner, Sra. Basilia Castellon Higuera, have been together for 25 years. They have 5 school-age children, all living at home. They live in a rural area near Colomi in Bolivia. Sr. Marcelino and his wife are farmers. They grow potatoes and other tuber crops that are common here. Selling the crop is their main source of income. They go to nearby Colomi on market days and sell the crops there. The income is how they support their family and save for their children's schooling. Sr. Marcelino is applying for a CIDRE loan so that he can buy organic (chicken) manure and a single head of cattle. The money will allow him to plant crops on more land and ensure that he can continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Auntie Akwele

texts.en: Auntie Akwele D. is divorced and has a child. She has received junior high education.  She sells both corn dough and cassava dough at Takoradi. She has been in this trade for about five years. Her loan will be added to her initial working capital to buy more corn to prepare corn dough and cassava for cassava dough for resale. D. plans to reinvest back into her business as a result of the loan she is going to receive.

loans.use: to buy more corn to prepare corn dough and cassava for cassava dough for resale

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena E. sells vegetables and yams at Takoradi.  Mena has no educational background.  She is married to a butcher and living together with her three children. Mena has been selling her goods for some time. She helps her husband in the payment of school fee and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Madres Trabajadoras” tiene  más de 3 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, para este ciclo incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que también emprenderán actividades.
 Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías. 
Todas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sandi quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en un puesto de venta que posee en el mercado de Asunción. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como   remeras, pantalones, buzos, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers) committee was formed more than three years ago and works with “Fundación Paraguaya.” Most of its members are already involved in productive businesses. During this cycle, they are adding two other entrepreneurial women. Their business activities include the sale of fruits and vegetables; the sale of artesian foods such as meat empanadas, chicken empanadas, ham and cheese empanadas; and the sale of general merchandise. All of them want a better future for their children, so they double their efforts to provide them what they need for their growth and development. One of the members, Sandi, sells clothing from a stall that she has in the Asunción market. She is asking for this loan to buy clothing, such as shirts, pants, jackets, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia L. smokes fish and has eggs for sale. She is a married woman living together with her husband and five dependents. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Her husband is a refrigerator repairman. She helps her husband in providing the basic needs for her family. She wants to use the loan buy more eggs and fish to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more eggs and more fish to process for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Y. is a seamstress and also sells slippers at Takoradi.  Comfort has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a technical officer. She helps her husband in the payment of school fee and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra cloth and other materials for her sewing. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a better shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy extra cloth and other materials for her sewing

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy A. sells second-hand clothes at Takoradi. She is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a teacher. Lucy uses her income to help her husband with the general welfare of her home. The loan s going to serve as additional capital to be used to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for sale.  Lucy plans to plough back her profit into her newly expanded business.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame Y. is married and has five dependents. Maame sells foodstuffs at Takoradi. She has been educated up to the senior high level. Her husband is a farmer.  Maame uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Maame will use the loan to purchase other foodstuffs for sale to her demanding customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase other foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda B. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Matilda sells smoked fish in Takoradi. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them, and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale. Her husband is a teacher. 

Matilda uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Matilda will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Matilda plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. operates a provisions shop at Takoradi. Maame has been through junior high school. She is married to a drinking sport operator and has four children. Maame has been selling provisions for some time. She helps her husband in taking care of her household. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal and provisions for sale. She plans of establishing another shop at a different locality should the business grow well.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal and provisions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING BEAUTY PRODUCTS SUCH AS HAIR COLORING, NAIL POLISH, HAIR TREATMENTS, AND CREAMS FOR HER BEAUTY SALON

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy N. is single and sells various types of rice both in small and larger quantities at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. Mercy uses her profit from her business to pay for her accommodations and bills.  Mercy will use the loan to purchase more rice and canned tomatoes which are going to serve as additional goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save to buy a real shop.

loans.use: more rice and canned tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is married and takes care of six children. She has been through senior high school. Efua sells yams, corn dough, smoked fish and other edible items at Takoradi. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her earnings in enhancing the welfare of her dependents. Efua will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase additional foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for young people for the upcoming season of the Santa Ana festivals

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta P. is into the sale of smoked fish at Takoradi. Atta has been educated to the senior high level.  She lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.  She helps her husband in educating her children. The acquisition of the loan will enable her to buy more fish to be able to supply more to her increasing customers. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to be processed for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She has acquired a junior high level of education.

Ekua sells smoked fish at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena Y. cooks kenkey for sale at Takoradi. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften it. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough from the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove (ferment and rise).

On the next day she divides the proved dough into two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds it into balls and wraps the balls in corn husk. She then cooks them again until they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish.

Abena has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband sells provisions. Abena has been selling kenkey for some time now. She is responsible by supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Abena’s loan will be used to buy more maize to use for kenkey to sell and to distribute. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to add another trade to her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to use for kenkey to sell and to distribute

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es:
El señor Constancio C. T. tiene 52 años de estado civil, viudo más de 2 años, de los 5 hijos solo está con él un hijo dependiente que estudia en nivel secundaria, la actividad  principal es la agricultura produce  papa, papa liza en su terreno que tiene 3 hectáreas en la comunidad de Kuri mayu, Don Constancio C. T. y su hijo viven en una comunidad Rural Kuri Mayu  a 62 km de la ciudad, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. 

El Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Don Constancio C. T. nos comenta que la esposa falleció en un accidentes de tránsito cuando retornaba de la feria de Colomi después de la venta de los productos, Don Constancio lo que quiere, es que, su hijo menor estudie y que salga profesional como técnico en agronomía para luego trabajar y tener mejores ingresos dar el  cuidado y mantener a su padre cuando ya sea viejito así para ya no sufrir, y con el crédito va sembrar  la papa en mas superficie y va poder ahorrar dinero para que estudie su hijo.
texts.en:
Constancio is 52 years old and was widowed more than two years ago. Of his five children only one is dependent on him, a son who is in high school. Constancio makes a living growing potatoes on his 3 hectares of land in Kuri Mayu, a rural community 62 kilometers away from the city, so it is very difficult to be approved for a loan from a bank. Kiva partner Cidre took the initiative of going to this rural area. Constancio tells us that his wife died in a traffic accident while she was returning from the Colomi flea market after selling her products there. What Constancio wants is for his youngest son to finish his studies and become a professional like an agronomy technician so he can work and earn a good income so he can provide and care for him when he becomes an old man so he doesn't suffer. With the loan, he plans to plant more potatoes so he can be able to save money for his son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and other supplies necessary for planting it

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background.

Mary sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Takoradi and makes use of her profits by supporting her husband in taking care of the home.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to use for kenkey production. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to use for kenkey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her inventory.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes B. is a widow who takes care of six dependents. She sells onions, fresh tomatoes, and other fresh vegetables at Takoradi and uses the profit she generates from her business to promote the general welfare of her home.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase extra onions and other foodstuffs to sell. With the new revenues from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a shop to sell in.

loans.use: To purchase extra onions and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchase of auto replacement parts for his business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes E. is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She has no educational background.

Agnes is a baker and also sells biscuits. She fries doughnuts and bakes other pastries at Takoradi. She adds her income to that of her husband to take care of the family.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a bigger oven.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua W. is divorced and takes care of four children. She has received junior high education.

Ekua cooks rice to sell at Takoradi. She has been selling cooked rice for some time now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ekua’s loan will be used to buy more rice and other ingredients to cook and sell. She hopes to reinvest in her business with the profit she is going to make.

loans.use: To buy more rice and other ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock her shop.

loans.name: Efu

texts.en:
M. Efu is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. M. has been through senior high education.

M. sells sponges at Takoradi. She has been selling sponges for some time and is responsible for helping her husband provide the basic needs of her family.

M.’s loan will be used to buy sponges in larger quantity to sell. She wishes to use the profits from her business to save to add another trade to her business.

loans.use: To buy sponges in larger quantity to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. sells bread and secondhand clothes at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer.

Margaret has been a baker for some time now and helps her husband to take care of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase additional ingredients to bake bread for sale. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. sells pipe-borne water at Takoradi. Felicia lives in an area where people do not have access to good drinking water. She has therefore paid for a water pipe to be installed and also bought a tank where good water will be stored and then sold to the people of her community.

Felicia has received senior high education. She is married and lives with her four children. Her husband is a teacher. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Felicia’s loan will be used to buy more poly-tanks to store more water. This will enable her to supply water to more people and also have enough to sell when there is shortage of water in the locality. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy extra poly tanks.

loans.use: To buy more poly-tanks to store more water

loans.name: Luis Joaquin

texts.es: Luis Joaquín tiene 44 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que son lo más importante pues es por ellos que él se esfuerza para salir adelante. Este es su quinto crédito con Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y puntual en sus cuotas. Su actividad económica es la venta y crianza de cerdos, el inicio este negocio hace 7 años por lo que tenía que buscar los medios necesarios para generar ingresos a su familia. Por lo que es un desafío para el mantener este negocio activo, por la escases de maní y otros alimentos necesarios para el engorde de los cerdos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de alimentos y compra de cerdos pequeños. Sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis Joaquín is 44 years old and has two children under his care. They are the most important thing to him and it's for them that he works so hard to make headway. This is his fifth loan with this organization and he has shown himself to be a very responsible and punctual person with his payments. He makes a living raising and selling pigs. He started his business seven years ago because he needed to find a way to earn an income for his family. It has been a challenge to maintain the business due to the shortage of peanuts and other food products necessary to fatten the pigs. He is requesting the loan to purchase feed and also buy some piglets. He dreams of expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase hardware supplies

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda O. is a seamstress and also sells cement at Takoradi. She has been through junior high school. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a building contractor.

Linda supports her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cement to meet the increase in demand for it. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cement to meet the increase in demand for it

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is divorced and has six dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Veronica sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and pig-feet at Takoradi. She plans to use the loan to buy additional bags of maize to prepare more kenkey and also to purchase larger quantities of pig feet for sale.

Veronica uses the income she generates from her sales to provide the basic needs of her children such as food, clothing and education. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of maize to prepare more kenkey and also buy larger quantities of pig feet to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase soaps, detergents, bleach, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and sells it locally. It is called “etew” by the Fante people at Takoradi. She serves it with okro (okra) stew and hot pepper sauce with fish and meat.

Faustina has no educational background. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Faustina’s loan will be used to buy more maize to be able to cook in bigger quantity for sale. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize to be able to cook in bigger quantity for sale

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando hace dos años en grupo, han tenido muchas experiencias juntas.
Todas trabajan juntas y también realizan actividades independientes para obtener ingresos para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Zunilda  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Ella ofrece sus productos saliendo hasta las casa y negocios de sus clientes, quienes constantemente solicitan las ropas que ella le ofrece por catalogos.
Sus clientes se encuentran muy satisfechos con las mercaderías que ella vende y tiene alto número de clientes.
Para cubrir con los pedidos que ella tiene ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas como camisas, pantalones, buzos, suéter y otros.
texts.en:
This committee has been in existence for two years. All of the members have plenty of experience working together. They also have independent business activities that help generate income for their families.

One of the members is Sra. Zunilda who is a clothing merchant. She sells her products by visiting the homes and businesses of her customers who are always ordering the clothes that she offers through catalogs. Zunilda has many customers and they are satisfied with the merchandise that she sells. In order to fulfill the orders that she has already received, Zunilda will use her loan to buy clothing such as shirts, trousers, sweatshirts, sweaters, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shirts, trousers, sweatshirts, sweaters, and other items

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 54-year-old woman who lives with her brother in Vazquez de Coronado, Costa Rica.

Teresita runs a type of corner store which is attached to her home. She sells various products including books, clothing for children as well as for adults, cleaning products and personal hygiene products. She also has a photocopying machine.

Teresita plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of inventory that she will sell in her store. She says that her lack of access to working capital (i.e. loans from formal lending institutions) has hindered her ability to expand her business, gain more clients and increase revenues.

Teresita organizes her day in the following manner: she wakes up early and cleans the house and store. If a client passes by, she opens up (no earlier than 6 a.m.) and the day begins. She stays open all day until 8 p.m.

Teresita’s main goal is to expand her business, fill her store with a variety of products and increase her revenues. A main obstacle for Teresita is that she lives in a rural area with a small population, which makes clients hard to come by.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as clothing, cleaners and books

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. sells oranges and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) both in small and larger quantities at Takoradi.

Efua is married to a security man and they have five dependents. She has not received any form of education. She uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the children.

Efua will use the loan to purchase more gari and more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more gari and more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase handbags & belts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to start a vegetable business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of seafood

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has two children. She is into the sale of fruit like bananas at Takoradi. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Her husband is a driver. She helps her husband by feeding the children.

Maame will use the loan to purchase more fruit to sell. With the new revenues from her expanded business, she plans to save to complete a building she has already started.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María F. G. se dedica a la comercialización de toda clase de mercancía especialmente electrodomésticos, ropa y calzado; vive en el Municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 18 a 39 años. María del Carmen es toda una experta en negocios, porque siempre, desde el año 1986, ha tenido uno: el primero fue un restaurante con su esposo, cuando éste se pensionó; luego una peluquería en su propia casa, al que adicionó la venta de prendas de oro y en el 1991 viajaba y traía mercancía para la venta desde Maicao, municipio fronterizo con Venezuela, pero cuando esta forma de negociar no fue rentable y empezó a encontrar en Barranquilla mercancía a buen precio, se dedicó exclusivamente a la venta de esta mercancía variada , mediante el sistema de crédito. María ha recibido 6 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que ha amortizado efectivamente, su credikiva es su séptimo crédito, con él comprará una lavadora, ropa, calzado y una balanza para negocio, todo esto ya encargado. Los financiamientos otorgados a María del Carmen han sido muy valiosos, porque con ellos ha logrado utilidades, convertidas hoy en aportes para su hogar, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la alimentación, el vestuario de sus hijos, apoyo a sus nietos y el poder contar siempre un capital efectivo para compras de oportunidad e inversión para su negocio. Aun sigue con el sueño de tener un restaurante bien organizado, porque le apasiona el área de preparación de alimentos. Sus desafíos están relacionados con la oferta de mercancías que hace la competencia, que muchas veces suele ser más económica, pero ella está en la tarea de explicarle a sus clientes, la relación del precio con la durabilidad como elementos de calidad, con la que ella trabaja. María F. es una mujer muy activa participa en la Junta de acción comunal del barrio donde vive, donde hace mucha gestión comunitaria, por eso la conocen en Soledad y además siempre está a la expectativa de captar nuevos clientes reales que le signifiquen ingresos.
texts.en:
María F. G. makes a living selling all types of merchandise, especially household appliances, clothing, and shoes. She lives in the city of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla, with her husband and four children who range in age from 18 to 39. María del Carmen is an expert at her business because she has always worked in her own venture since 1986. The first business she had was a restaurant she managed with her husband when he became a pensioner. Later she started a beauty salon in her home and eventually began selling gold jewelry in 1991. María also traveled and brought back merchandise to sell from Maicao, a town that lies near the border with Venezuela. Whenever her traveling retail business became less profitable, she began purchasing merchandise in Barranquilla at a better price. Now she devotes herself exclusively to selling different types of merchandise on credit.

María has received six previous loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has paid them off effectively. This Kiva loan will be her seventh one and she will use it to purchase a washing machine, clothing, shoes, and a scale for her business since she has already received orders for these items. The loans that were provided to María del Carmen have been valuable because they helped her generate income to buy products for her home, especially food and clothing for her children. She also supports her grandchildren, so she would like to have sufficient capital so that she can take advantage of buying opportunities and investments in her business. She continues to dream of having a well-organized restaurant once again because she is passionate about preparing food. Her greatest challenge with her retail business is competition because there have been many instances in which other merchants sell goods that are much cheaper. However, it is her job to explain to her customers the relationship between price and specific elements of quality such as durability.

María is an active board member of the community action committee in her neighborhood, which does a lot of work related to community development. She is well-known in Soledad and is always looking for new customers to help generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a washing machine, clothing, shoes, and a scale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. sells firewood at Takoradi. She is married to a driver and lives with her three children. She has no educational background. She helps her husband with the general welfare of her children.

Ama is going to add the loan to her initial capital to purchase more firewood to distribute to her customers. With the new earnings from her extended business, she plans to save to build a storehouse for her wood to protect it from the rain.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with two daughters. She lives in Zaporozhye. Svetlana sells women’s outer clothing in one of the biggest marketplaces of her home town. She owns a vending location and also rents two more and has hired employees to work there. Svetlana has been in business for over 12 years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her monthly income amounts to 18,000 Grivnyas. 

Svetlana is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal footwear for the up-coming fall season. She is a typical workaholic, ready to spend long hours at work to achieve success. Svetlana is hoping to see her business grow and develop. One of her long-term goals is to purchase a nice facility and open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Guillemina Angelica

texts.es:
Guillermina de 52 años, , vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales), ella tiene un taller de costura y también tiene una pequeña papelería. 

Hace 30 años atrás, ella comenzó con el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo económicamente. El esposo también trabaja como confeccionista de ropa. Con dedicación los dos comenzaron a trabajar confeccionando ropa hasta ahora que trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días, tienen una pequeña papelería en su negocio. 

Para poder incrementar su producción ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y una maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de ropa con su marca.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 52 years old and lives in Surburbio de Guayaquil, where most of the residents are informal merchants. She has a sewing workshop and also manages a small stationery store.

Thirty years ago, Guillermina started her business so that she could help her husband financially. His job also involves manufacturing clothing. With dedication the two of them began working together to make clothes. Now their work schedule is from 8am to 5pm every day, which includes running the stationery shop as part of their business.

In order to increase her production, Guillermina wants to use her loan to buy fabrics and a sewing machine. In the future, she hopes to have a distribution center where she can sell her own brand of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & a sewing machine

loans.name: Maame Daavi

texts.en:
Maame Daavi A. sells beans, salted fish, onions, salt and other food items at Takoradi. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is an engineer and she has four children. She is responsible by supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Maame Daavi’s loan will be used to buy more and a greater variety of foodstuffs to meet the demand of her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy more and a greater variety of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea tiene 52 años, es madre soltera que vive en la comunidad de Boquerón Alto de la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Dorotea es una persona humilde su casa es con techo de paja la pared de barro vive con sus dos hijos trabaja solita en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos. La actividad principal de la señora es agricultura que produce papa y haba el crédito que esta solicitando es para insumos agrícolas el objetivo de la señora es mejorar su producción de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 

Su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive junto a sus hijos, también desea poder ver a sus hijos salir de la escuela y estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Dorotea is 52 years old and a single mother who lives in the community of Boquerón Alto in Tiraque Province, Department of Cochabamba. She is a humble person who owns a house made of mud walls and a thatched roof. Most of the time she works alone, but she occasionally receives help from her neighbors. Her main business activity is agriculture, growing potatoes and beans. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies so that she can improve her production and increase her earnings.

Her greatest wish for the future is to improve the conditions of the house in which she lives with her children. She also wants to see them get ahead in school and study for a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena K. is married and has four children. Her husband is a security man. She has attained senior high level of education.

Mena cooks rice at Takoradi to sell. She has been in this business for some time and uses her income to support her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her home.

Mena will use the loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. cooks banku for sale at Takoradi (banku is a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup.).

Akua has received no educational background. She is married and has three children. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Akua’s loan will be used to buy more maize, some to cook and some to sell raw. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to beautify her sales location so she can get more customers.

loans.use: To buy more maize, some to cook and some to sell raw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of seafood

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a grown daughter. She is a market entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. Svetlana sells men’s outer wear in the central marketplace of her home town. She has been in business for 10 years. Currently, Svetlana has 70,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her income amounts to 20,000 Grivnyas.  

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase school uniforms for boys that always sell well in the end of summer before the start of a new school year. Increased sales will help Svetlana generate additional income to be re-invested in business development. The clothing sales business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba K. is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a driver. She has not received any form of education.

Abiba smokes fish at Takoradi for sale and uses her earning to support her husband in promoting the wellbeing of their children.

Abiba will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products for her business such as basic grains, sodas, personal products, soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables, such as onions, peppers, lemons, and shellfish

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es:
Luis de 53 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales) el tiene un taller de cerrajería (lugar donde se reparan puertas, y cerraduras). 

El comenzó hace 12 años para poder mantener a su familia recorría las calles del Guasmo con sus herramientas, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio taller de cerrajería, Ahora trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, con alguno de sus hijos. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y materiales de cerrajería, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old. He lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil (an urban zone where most of the residents are informal merchants). He has a locksmith shop where he repairs doors and locks. He started 12 years ago to be able to support his family. He walked the streets of the Guasmo with his tools and little by little with his hard work was able to open his own workshop. Now he works there every day starting very early with some of his children. To be able to continue with the business, he wants to buy tools and locksmith materials with the loan. In the future he wants to re-build his house with his earnings from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools, materials

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: Martha Guadalupe tiene 45 años. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que desde que inicio ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante. Por lo que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio y se siente muy agradecida con esta ayuda. Por lo que todos los días recorre distancias muy largas para ofrecer lo que vende. Con este crédito lograra comprar perfumes, lápiz labial, polvos, calzado y tratamientos.
texts.en:
Martha Guadalupe is 45 years old. Her activity is selling general merchandise. She has been doing this business for more than 9 years. From the beginning she has offered her products as a street vendor. The loans have been a big help for her business and she is very grateful for this help. Every day she covers great distances to offer what she sells. With this loan, she will be able to buy perfumes, lipsticks, powders, shoes and treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy vegetables by the "quintal"  (one quintal is 46kg) and by the case, carrots, squash, cabbage, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions, etc.

loans.name: El Buen Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Buen Progreso es un grupo solidario de larga trascendencia, pero a su vez de muchos cambios a través de su historia. Actualmente se encuentra conformado por Blanca López E., Miriam del Carmen D. T. y Olga de la Cruz Arroyo C..

Blanca, quien es su coordinadora desde hace 2 años es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada de 34 años que se dedica a la compra/venta de cosechas de distintas frutas desde hace 7 años. Ella es soltera y se dedica a comercializar las compras de Tamarindo y Nancite preferiblemente en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Miriam y Olga son mujeres maduras de 51 y 57 años respectivamente, la primera es comerciantes de cosméticos de forma ambulante en su comunidad y el mercado de Masaya; en cambio Olga vende nacatamales en su casa pero su principal actividad es destace de cerdos y la venta de leña.

Estas tres mujeres tienen una gran fortaleza y deseos de superación a pesar de las adversidades que han tenido. Ellas invertirán el crédito otorgado para la compra de nuevos insumos para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Buen Progreso” (Good Progress) communal bank has prevailed for a long time. There have been many changes through the years. The group is currently comprised of Blanca López E., Miriam del Carmen D. T., and Olga de la Cruz Arroyo C.. Blanca has been the coordinator for two years. She is a hard-working and dedicated 34 year old woman. She has been buying and selling different fruit crops for seven years. She is single. She devotes herself to selling tamarind and “nancite” (a Nicaraguan berry). She prefers to sell in the market in the Mayasa municipality. Miriam and Olga are mature women, 51 and 57 years old respectively. The first one sells cosmetics in an iterant manner in her community and the Masaya market. On the other hand, Olga sells “nacatamales” (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale) in her house. However, her main activities are butchering pigs and selling firewood. These three women have great strength and the desire to excel in spite of the adversities they have faced. They will use the loan to buy new supplies in order to increase their working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy various products like soft drinks, dairy products, Pampers, and soups, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business: boys' and girls' clothing, toys, flatware, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto de 24 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una pequeña tienda de bebidas y lácteos. 

Comenzó vendiendo bebidas en el Guasmo, a sus amigos, vecinos, conocidos, con esfuerzo pudo readecuar una parte de su casa para tener su pequeña tienda, ahora el trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, vende bebidas, lácteos y otros víveres. 

Para surtir mas su pequeña tienda el quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas y lácteos y así tener la oportunidad de ser un joven microempresario. En el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de bebidas.
texts.en:
Roberto is 24 years old and lives in the barrio of El Guasmo in Guayaquil (an urban zone, the majority of whose residents are merchants in the informal sector). He has a small store that sells drinks and milk products. Roberto began selling drinks in El Guasmo to his friends, neighbors, and those he knew. With effort, he was able to remodel a part of his house to contain his little shop. Now, he works from 9:00am until 10:00pm every day, selling drinks, milk products, and other provisions. To restock his small store he needs a loan to buy drinks and milk products and, thus, to have the opportunity to be a micro-entrepreneur. In the future, he wishes to become a drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages and dairy products

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
la señora Ciriaca C. Burgos tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Bartolome Bonilla quien se dedica a la agricultura, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella.
su fuente de ingresos es la compra y venta de queso, mantequilla y quesillo.
doña Ciriaca tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual le a permitido darle estudios a sus hijos y sacar adelante su hogar.
Ciriaca es una persona muy emprendedora y responsable con sus compromisos.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de queso y mantequilla ya que desea invertir un poco mas para lograr asi mas utilidades.
su mayor deseo es que las ventas se mejoren ya que debido a la crisis economica del pais las ventas han bajado.
texts.en:
Ciriaca C. Burgos, 59, is married to Bartolome Bonilla, a farmer, and has no dependent children. Her source of income is through the purchase and resale of cheese, butter and quesillo (a soft crumbly cheese made from partially skimmed milk). Ciriaca has been in this business for a number of years which has allowed her to pay for her children’s schooling and improve their standard of living. Ciriaca is a very enterprising person who is responsible about her commitments. She will use the loan to buy cheese and butter since she wishes to invest a little more in order to achieve greater earnings. Her greatest wish is for her sales to improve since they have been weak on account of the economic crisis in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic ingredients such as rice, beans and oil

loans.name: Anahi Lorena

texts.es: La señora Anahi es Madre soltera tiene 2 hijos nacidos en Santa Cruz, su pareja el Sr. Taurino, tambien agricultor, Ella ha obtenido su tierra mediande compra. Son 1942 Hectareas en la cual siembra Maiz, Sandia, Maní y otros productos. Tiene 10 cabezas de ganado todo lo que siembra ella lo saca a vender al mercado de El Torno, ella distribuye directo al Consumidor, su pareja le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el dinero del credito lo utilizaran en la contratacion de tractor y mano de obra para el preparado d ela tierra para la siembra, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Anahi is a single mother of two children, both born in Santa Cruz. She and her partner, Mr. Taurino, are both agricultural workers. She has purchased her own land; her property is 1942 hectares, on which she cultivates corn, watermelon, peanuts, and other products. She has ten livestock animals. She takes everything that she harvests to sell at the market in El Torno. She distributes her products directly to the consumer. Her partner helps her with household expenses. They will use this loan to hire a tractor and day laborers to prepare the soil for planting. She is a very responsible and hard-working person, always thinking of the wellbeing of her family. She is very grateful to the institution for the support shown to her.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire a tractor and extra labor to prepare soil for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business, such as new and used magazines and used footwear for resale

loans.name: Laura Lourdes

texts.es:
C. B. LAURA LOURDES

Hace seis años Laura emprende en el negocio de crianza de cuyes, es muy gracioso escucharla decir que estos animalitos no le gustaban de joven y que ahora es un sustento para su hogar.
Fue en el cumpleaños de su prima quien le regaló cuatro cuyes hembras para que empiece a criarlos, tuvo que comprar un macho para la reproducción, el alimento que les da a estos animalitos es alfalfa, harina de pescado y afrechin. El primer crédito que recibió lo invirtió para comprar medicamento de desparasitación lo cual lo hace dos veces al año.
Las hembras salieron preñadas; las crías los venden cuando tienen unos cuantos meses de crecido, a veces también lo utiliza para su propia alimentación. Actualmente tiene dieciocho cuyes y dos hembras quienes están preñadas. Estas ventas le ayudan en educar a sus hijos uno está estudiando en la universidad la especialidad de Físico-Matemática y los otros dos aún estudian en el colegio. El préstamo es para compra un macho y comprar alimento balanceado. Asimismo Laura cocina en una parroquia de Huarochiri donde percibe un ingreso mas para su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Laura Lourdes C. Briceño Laura began raising guinea pigs as a business 6 years ago. It's comical to hear her say that as a child she didn't like these little critters but how they now help support the household. It was on a cousin's birthday when she received 4 female guinea pigs so she could begin raising them; she had to purchase a male to begin reproduction. The animals are fed alfalfa, fishmeal, and bran. She invested her first loan in deworming medication which she applies twice a year. The females turned out pregnant and the offspring are later sold after a few months, she even sometimes uses them to feed herself. She currently has 18 guinea pigs, 2 of which are pregnant. The sales are helping her get her children through school, one is at the university specializing in physics-math and her other two children are still in school. The loans is for the purchase of balanced feed, and a male guinea pig. Laura also cooks at a parish in Huarochiri as another form of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural materials to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Zinc sheets, stone, blocks, sand

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilian de 29 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber hace un año atrás, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo de Guayaquil. 

Ella comenzó con el negocio del Cyber trabajando solo con una computadora, como en el sector por donde vive era mucha la demanda, decidió comprar otra computadora, así poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias hasta que pudo tener su propio local. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22:00pm. La hora de Internet cobrar $ 0.60ct. 

Para poder incrementar las computadoras y una mejor atención a la clientela quiere comprar con el préstamo computadoras. En el futuro quiere tener una línea de Cyber.
texts.en:
Lilian is 29 years old, and has had a small cyber-café for a year now. She lives in the Guasmo urban area of Guayaquil. She started her internet business working with only one computer. Because demand was great in her area, she decided to buy another computer, and gradually increased her earnings to the point that she could have her own site. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and charges her internet hours at $0.60. In order to increase the number of computers and provide better attention to her customers, she wants to buy computers with the loan. In the future, she would like to have a chain of cybercafes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fast food sales:  hotdogs, tacos, sandwiches, hamgurgers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy medicines.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Estela A. tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Gonzalo Posadas quien se dedica a la compra y venta de dolares en la frontera el Amatillo, tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos.
la señora A. se dedica al negocio de pulperia, tiene varios años con su negocio en el cual vende queso, pollo, carnes, refrescos ,jabon, azucar, café etc
esta ubicado en el barrio Morazan de Nacaome Valle, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, Santos es una persona muy trabajadora de muy buenos principios morales y espirituales.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su pulperia.
 
su mayor deseo es que su hija se le gradue de la universidad y que su negocio crezca cada dia que pasa.
texts.en:
Santos Estela A., 41, is married to Gonzalo Posadas who earns a living buying and selling dollars at the border town of El Amatillo. They have three children whom they support. Ms. A. owns and manages a grocery store where for a number of years she has sold cheese, chicken and other meats, soft drinks, ham, sugar, coffee etc. Her business is located in the Morazan neighborhood of Nacaome Valle and she is open for business Monday to Sunday. Santos is a very hardworking person with very good moral and spiritual principles. She will use the loan to invest in her grocery store. Her greatest wish is that her daughter get a college degree and that her business would grow with each passing day.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, sugar, bread, cookies, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, soft drinks, milk, juices, soups, pasta, salsas, salt, condiments, soap and toilet paper.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING FISH AND SHELL-FISH TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cement and stone

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El señor Pastor C. Q. tiene 36 años y vive en casa de sus padres en el barrio 3 de Mayo de la ciudad de Tarija. Pastor es casado con la señora Angelica Vargas Gutierrez de 33 años de edad con quien tiene 4 hijos. Pastor se dedica a trabajar como taxista desde hace más de 10 años.   
                                                                                                                                                                                                   Pastor quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar un equipo de gas natural para su vehículo con lo cual el costo del combustible que utiliza para trabajar le sería mucho más barato y sus gastos serian reducidos en más de la mitad. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra del equipo de gas para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Pastor nos cuenta que quiere darles a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Pastor C. Q., 36, lives in his parents’ home in the May 3rd neighborhood of the city of Tarija. Pastor is married to Angelica Vargas Gutierrez, 33, with whom he has four children. Pastor works as a taxi driver which he has done for over ten years. Pastor wants a better income in order to offer a better life to his family, but tells us he needs to purchase a system for outfitting his vehicle for natural gas by which his fuel costs would be much lower and his expenses would be cut by more than half. Thus the loan will be used to purchase a natural gas system so that he will be able to enhance his income. Pastor tells us that he wants to do as much as he can for his spouse and children and so the next loan request he makes will be for improving the condition of the house where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a natural gas system for his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro A. M. tiene 28 años convive con la Señora Elsa Olivera Muñoz más de 10 años, tienen 2 hijos menores dependientes, viven en sector de Aguirre que está ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Don Alejandro es albañil realiza construcción de vivienda en la misma zona, es una persona humilde pero trabajador, el necesita dinero para comprar lote de terreno, para poder construir su vivienda propia, para ello es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad y les piden muchos requisitos, 

El cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona y otorgar crédito, Alejandro está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito de cidre, ahora va poder comprar el lote de terreno que estaba en venta, así va tener  su vivienda, y podra mas comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro A. M., 28, has lived with Elsa Olivera Muñoz for over ten years. They have two dependent minor children and live in the Aguirre sector which is located 42 km from Cochabamba. Alejandro is a construction worker who builds housing in the same area. He is a humble but hard-working person and needs the money to purchase a plot of land in order to build his own house. It is very difficult to go to the Banks in the city for it where they have many requirements. CIDRE took the iniciative of going into that area and granting loans and Alejandro is very happy to have been able to get a loan from them. Now he will be able to purchase the lot that was for sale and so will have his housing and be able to provide greater comfort to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a small lot in order to build his home

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Beatriz E. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome, radica
en ese lugar desde hace 19 años, ahi se han crecido todos sus hijos, dedicandose por varios años a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, este negocio lo realiza junto con su hija menor, vende las tortillas en el mercado de Nacaome y con varios clientes fijos que tiene que recogen las tortillas en su casa.
 
la señora E. es una madre viuda que ha educado a sus hijos luchando ya que su esposo murio hace varios años y le ha tocado mantener a la familia y sacarla adelante
 
el credito lo utilizara parar comprar harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos.
gracias a su negocio a mejorado la condiciones de vida de su familia, ya que con las ganancias hizo un baño,
puso piso de la casa, mejoro la cocina y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Beatriz E., 42, lives in the Suyapa neighborhood of the Honduran city of Nacaome. She settled in the town 19 years ago and raised her children there. She has earned a living, for several years, making and selling tortillas, a business that she operates with her youngest daughter. She sells the tortillas to customers in the market at Nacaome and to a few regular customers who pick up tortillas at her house. Sra.
