E. is a widow who has struggled since her husband's death to make sure that her children are educated and that the family get ahead in the world. Sra. E. will use the loan to buy flour, wood, quicklime, water and matches. Thanks to the business, she has managed to improve the lives of her family by building a bathroom, laying a floor, improving the kitchen and other things, as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: El señor Bacilio nacido en Chuquisaca el 2 de Enero de 1989 casado con la Sra. Nolberta tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en la comunidad de Nueva Esperanza a 20 Km de Santa Rita, en la cual tiene sus tierra, 7 hectares aptas para la agricultura y ganaderia, tiene 2 vacas, 3 chanchos. Vive en la misma parcela trabajando de agricultor y para ayudarse el hace carbón, también es uno de los dirigentes del sindicato de la zona, es una persona respetada y responsable, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la siembra de maiz, contratara manpo de obra para la preparacion de la tierra y posterior siembra, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de la localidad, esta muy agardecido con la institucion por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Sr. Bacilio was born in Chuquisaca on January 2, 1989. He is married to Sra. Nolberta and has 2 school-age children. They live in Nueva Esperanza, a small community some 20 kilometers from the Bolivian town of Santa Rita. Bacilio is a farmer and he owns 7 hectares of good agricultural land. He raises livestock, as well: 2 cows and 3 pigs. To earn extra money, he makes coal for fuel. Bacilio is one of the directors of the local cooperative and he is known and respected in the community. He will use the money to grow maize. He will hire laborers to prepare and plant the crop and, at the harvest, sell the crop at the local market. Bacilio is very grateful to the institution for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Marioly Maria

texts.es:
Marioly de 36 años, tiene una tienda pequeña, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo de Guayaquil. 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la parte delantera de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Ella quiere surtir mas su tienda por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas, y arroz. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para vender arroz por quintal.
texts.en:
Marioly is 36 years old, has a small store, and lives in an urban area named Guasmo of Guayaquil.

She started selling candies and beverages in a display cabinet and little by little began supplying her shop with supplies. Now she has a small store located on the front part of her home and sells candies, beverages, and grains. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. everyday.

She wants to supply her store with more goods which is why she wants to buy more display cabinetss and rice with her loan. In the future she wants to buy a truck to sell rice in lots of 100lbs.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of display cabinets and rice.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El señor Benedicto Solís López tiene 28 años convive con la Señora Emeteria Robles Urey mas de  12 años, tiene 4 hijos menores dependientes que estudia en nivel primaria en la escuela rural de la comunidad, la actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa en terreno que tiene 2 hectáreas sector Liquintaya, Benedicto y su familia son familia humilde de poco recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 56 km de la ciudad para ellos  acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.

El Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. donde Don Benedicto Solís López necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola, Benedicto nos comenta que tiene poco superficie de terreno para sembrar, pero otras personas tienen tierras agrícolas grandes y a él ofertan para que trabajara en su terreno al partido y para ello  necesita capital para sembrar en los terrenos y producir más papa y tener ingreso económico mayor que  le permite ahorrar dinero para comprar terreno agrícola propio y hacer estudiar a su hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Benedicto Solís López is 28 years old and has been living with Mrs. Emeteria Robles Urey for more than 12 years. They have 4 dependent children who attend an elementary school in the rural community. The main activity here is agriculture. He grows potatoes on 2 hectares (20,000 square meters) in the Liquintaya area. They live 56 km from the city and to come all the way to the banks to request a loan is very difficult.

Field Partner Cidre took the initiative to go to rural areas. Mr. Benedicto Solís López needed money to buy organic fertilizer to sow in this agricultural countryside. Benedicto tells us he has little land to sow on but others have large amounts of land that they are offering him to work on. To be able to do that he needs materials to sow and grow more potatoes to make a highest possible profit which will allow him to save up money to buy his own land and let his children study.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizer to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La señora Luisa es cliente desD. el año 2004 comenzó con el grupo solidario Flor del Campo durante cinco años, actualmente se independiza como crédito individual por que el otro integrante del grupo viajo a su pueblo y no se sabe cuando retornara. Doña luisa es una mujer bastante trabajadora pese a que se separo D. su esposo no se dio por vencida y saca adelante a sus tres hijos sin descuidar sus estudios ya que dos D. ellos aun están en colegio y la mayor se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.  Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona alto tejar, avenida entre ríos,  casa D. sus señores padres.  La actividad que realiza es la venta D. comida hace 17 años su puesto D. venta es en la puerta D. su domicilio,  es una señora bastante emprendedora que desea seguir trabajando con la institución.  El crédito será destinado para la compra D. abarrotes por mayor  también comprara papa, tunta, chuño y otros.
texts.en:
Luisa has been a client since 2004 who started with the “Flor D. Campo” (Flower of the Field) group. Currently she is requesting this loan independently, because the other member of the group traveled to his (her) village and she doesn’t know when s/he will return. Ms. Luisa is a hard working woman. When she separated from her husband, she didn’t give up and has managed to move her three children ahead without disrupting their studies. Two of them attend school and the oldest studies at the university. Her home is located in the Alto Tejar zone, Avenida Entre Rios, Casa D. Sus Señores Padres. For 17 years she’s been selling food from a stall located within her home. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who wants to continue working with the institution. She will use the money from this loan to buy groceries in bulk, and also potatoes, tuna, chuño (a kind of Peruvian potato) and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.es:
la señora Suyapa A. tiene 41 años de edad, es originaria de Nacaome Valle. radica en el barrio Suyapa, ahí tiene su casa de habitacion que tiene 21 años de tenerla,  ahí han crecido su hijos y ella se ha desarrollado como comerciante de tortillas, negocio que realiza desde muy temprano todos los dias y gracias a este negocio  a salido adelante y les ha dado los estudios a sus hijos.
 
doña Suyapa es una persona muy humilde y de muy buenos principios, muy responsable con sus compromisos.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de maiz, leña, cal, agua, fosforos y para fabricar paletas de fruta y chocobananos.
texts.en:
Suyapa Aguilas, 41, is from Nacaome Valle. She lives in Suyapa neighborhood in a home that she’s owned for 21 years. Her children have grown up there and she has developed as a tortilla merchant, a job she starts very early in the morning every day. Thanks to this business she has managed to get ahead in life and has been able to provide her children with an education. Suyapa is a person who is very humble, has good moral principles and is very responsible with her commitments. She is asking for funding to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, water and matches and for ingredients to make fruit popsicles and chocolate covered bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, firewood, lime powder, water, matches, flavoring agents, popsicles, bananas, liquid chocolate, fruits, sugar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramon Nonato

texts.es: El señor Ramón Nonato tiene 64 años, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan de manera independiente, el se dedica a una pulpería.  Actividad que la realiza desde hace unos  años. Ramón utilizara el crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, leche y detergentes para vender al por mayor y al detalle. Su deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que estudien cada día mas para que puedan tener una mejor condición de vida y puedan salir adelante por si solos. Ramón es una persona muy gentil, responsable con mucho esmero y dedicación por su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Nonato, 64, has 6 children who all work independently; he’s been a grocer for several years. Ramón will use the funds to buy stock items like: sweets, beverages, bread, milk and detergents to sell both at wholesale and retail. His wish is that his children become professionals and that they study daily in order to have better living conditions and be able to get ahead in life on their own. Ramón is very kind, responsible and dedicated to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
María Agustina es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos de sus cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Cajamarca, una ciudad ubicada en la sierra norte del país, bastante cococida por sus atractivos paisajes y legado histórico, es también una de las ciudades con mayor movimiento comercial de la sierra del país, se encuentra ubicada a seis horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

María Agustina cuenta con un restaurante desde hace mas de cinco años, ella prepara diversos platos típicos de la región y los ofrece a los diversos turistas y publico en general que transitan por la zona, la buena sazón con la que prepara los productos han hecho que actualmente cuente con una clientela fija y que su negocio se haya desarollado correctamente. Las ganancias que ella percibe de esta actividad las utiliza ayudando a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

María desea adquirir mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos de comida, de modo que pueda ampliar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyma Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer tranquila y amable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando en su negocio para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, sus clientes y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
María Agustina, 40, lives with her husband and two of her four children in the city of Cajamarca, a city located in the country’s northern mountains, well-known for its attractive scenery and historic legacy. It is also one of the cities with the most commercial activity in the country’s mountain area. It is located six hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. María Agustina has had a restaurant for over five years. She prepares various meals typical of the region for tourists and the general public that travel through the area. Her tasty preparations have led to her having a steady stream of regular customers and to her business’ developing properly. Profits she earns here help her husband meet family expenses. María wants to acquire more ingredients to prepare still more dishes so that her sales will increase and thus her earnings will increase, too. To reach this goal she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1000 new sol loan. María is a level-headed, kind person whose greatest wish is to continue working in her business to help her family get ahead. Her customers and acquaintances hold her in high regard and consider her to be an honest and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Señor De Luren Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Señor de Luren inicia su ciclo 9 con 12 socias que pertenecen al distrito de Huancavelica, cuya actividad económica principal es el comercio.
Yolanda es una de las socias del bancomunal, este ciclo tiene el cargo de Tesorera en la Junta Directiva. Yolanda tiene 3 hijos jóvenes de 26, 18 y 16 años de edad, Yolanda tiene como negocio una librería pequeña, donde vende útiles de escritorio como son cuadernos, hojas, lápices, todo tipo de papelería; su negocio se inició con poca mercadería, poco a poco ha ido implementando de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes, ahora tiene también una fotocopiadora, hace servicio de copias, ploteo y tipeo de documentos. Los préstamos que recibe Yolanda los utiliza en la compra de útiles al por mayor y en cantidad para su negocio. Su sueño es tener una librería grande y exportar pedidos al por mayor a instituciones de su localidad.
texts.en:
The “Señor de Luren” (Lord of Luren) communal bank starts its 9th cycle with 12 members who are from Huancavelica district whose main economic activity is commerce. Yolanda is one of the members and is serving as Treasurer on the governing board during this cycle. She has three young children who are 26, 18 and 16 years of age. Yolanda has a small bookstore where she sells stationery items like: notebooks, sheets of paper, pencils and all types of paper goods. She started the business with just a few items but gradually has been stocking it according to the needs of her customers. Now, she also has a photocopying machine and provides copying services as well as document typing and formatting. The loans that Yolanda receives are used to buy school supplies at wholesale and in large quantities for her store. Her dream is to have a large bookstore and to be able to fill large orders for all her local schools.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Martires

texts.es:
la sra. Martires G. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Orlando Pavon con quien tiene tres hijos que estan en la escuela, Martires radica junto a su familia en su casa ubicada en Jicaro Galan de Nacaome Valle, ahi viven desde hace unos 17 años.
Martires se dedica al negocio de pulperia, siempre a querido tener su propio negocio, Martires en su pulperia vende abarroteria como ser: manteca, jabon, azucar, harina de maiz, cloro, desinfectantes, cereal, refrescos, pan, huevos, leche, sardinas, pastas, chiles, tortillas y otra variedad de productos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir mas su pulperia.
su deseo es que sus hijos se graduen de sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mártires G., 44, is married to Mr. Orlando Pavón; they have three children who are in school. Mártires and her family live in their home located in Jicaro Galan de Nacome Valle; they have lived there for 17 years. Mártires has a grocery store where she stocks such things as: lard, soap, sugar, corn flour, chlorine bleach, disinfectants, cereal, beverages, bread, eggs, milk, sardines, pasta, chilies, tortillas and a large variety of other products. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise at wholesale thus stocking her store better. Her wish is that her children graduate from school and that they become good professionals and upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sardines, toilet paper, soups, lard, cooking oil, soaps, pastas, salt, spices, batteries, razors, beans, tortillas, sugar, rice, bread, cookies, beverages.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mirna Edith

texts.es:
Mirna Edith V. N., tiene la edad de 42 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar una vaca para la producción de leche para el consumo de su familia y si es posible para la venta. Además, su finca es de 3 hectáreas con pasto de buena calidad y también cuenta con más terneros en desarrollo y engorde. La propiedad de Mirna cuenta con un clima más fresco y con una cantidad de agua potable que fluye naturalmente desde la zona protegida del Cerro Chirripó. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca que se le aproveche mejor sus condiciones productivas. También, ella no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales o entidades financieras, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Mirna Edith V. N. is 42 years old, married and has two children who are her highest priority. She would like to purchase a cow to provide milk for her family and, if possible, to sell the milk as well. She has 3 hectares of farmland with good grass and more calves that she is fattening up. Her property enjoys a cool climate and has a large quantity of drinkable water that flows from the protected area of Cerro Chirripó. She has worked the farm for many years and wants it to grow. This is the first loan that Mirna has received from FUDECOSUR. She has no problems with her property, but wants to take better advantage of the opportunities for production. She has not taken out loans with other state banks or financial organizations, as FUDECOSUR offers her better credit facilities and much lower interest rates. She would also like to provide her children with the necessary education so that in the future they can be more prepared to deal with what life brings them. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow to produce milk

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
DesD. las 7:00  D. L. mañana hasta horas muy tarD. en L. noche, en un lugar ubicado en plena avenida murillo, cercano a importantes centros comerciales D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. y bajo un calor refrescado por los vientos alisios que soplan  L. ciudad en sus distintas épocas, usted pasa y encuentra siempre D. domingo a domingo a Iván Darío, sentado en su escritorio compuesto por una silL. y una mesa  plástica, ubicada al lado D. su chaza   D. madera, colmada  D. dulces y pasabocas, vendiendo a peatones, que por allí circulan y que últimamente han potencializando el que él, haya iniciado su otro negocio D.  servicio D. llamadas telefónicas.

Iván es un joven caribe D. naturaleza alegre y cordial, que forma parte D. L. Asociación D. vendedores del sur D. L. ciudad  “Asovesur” organización que agremia a todos los comerciantes estacionarios del sur D. BarranquilL., ubicados alrededor del centro comercial Metrocentro, próximos a ser reubicados en una galería en construcción dispuesta por el estado para continuar el proceso organizacional  D. sus zonas peatonales, que se viene gestando en L. ciudad. Su negocio  está ubicado en un sitio D. alta competencia muy bien aprovechado por él, porque  conoce a sus competidores  y sabe que D. sus interrelaciones depenD. su sostenibilidad y el mejoramiento D. su ingreso, como lo ha venido haciendo día a día.

 El pago D. su obligación en los 4 créditos a través D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo han  distinguido por su puntualidad; por esta razón está solicitando un credikiva para continuar incrementando sus ventas, aumentar su capital D. trabajo y mejorar su nivel D. vida familiar, como hasta ahora lo ha venido haciendo. Con este financiamiento está interesado en adicionar planes D. celulares y comprar productos D. cigarrería en general.   En el futuro planea obtener su vivienda propia a través del programa sueños y oportunidades, en L. urbanización  villas D. San Pablo, para lo cual   L. F.M.S.D. trabaja en L. postulación al subsidio estatal y gestiona su proceso D. crédito  para hacer el  cierre financiero D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
You will find Ivan every day from 7:00am until late at night, in an open location on Murillo Avenue, near important commercial centers of the city of BaranquilL., feeling the refreshing heat of the traD. winds that favor the city in distinct seasons. He will be seated at his 'desk', composed of a plastic chair and table, alongsiD. his wooden display filled with sweets and snacks, selling to pedestrians who circulate there. The latter have also provided potential that motivated him to start his other business, offering telephone calling plans. Ivan is a young Carib, by nature happy and cordial, who belongs to “Asovesur”, the organization that brings together all the stationary merchants located around BaranquilL.'s 'Metrocentro', its commercial center. They will soon be relocated to a gallery in construction as ordered by the state, as part of the city's pedestrian zone organizing process. Ivan's business is located where there is much competition and he takes advantage of that. He knows his competitors and understands that his sustainability depends upon interrelations with them, as does increasing his income, which is occurring day to day. Ivan's punctual repayment of his 4 loans with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo have distinguished him. For this reason, he is now soliciting a Kiva loan to continue increasing his sales, augmenting his working capital, and to continue improving his family's standard of living, as he has been doing up to now. With this loan he wants to acquire additional cellular phone plans and to buy the products generally needed by a tobacconist's shop. In the future he plans to obtain his own home through the 'Sueños y Opportunidades' (Dreams and Opportunities) program in Villas D. San Pablo, by means of which the Foundation works with state subsidies to offer loans to assist with the financial closing for dwellings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ADDING CELL PHONE PLANS AND BUYING PRODUCTS SUCH AS SWEETS, AND A VARIETY OF SNACKS TO SELL

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Salvador Antonio tiene 42 años, es casado tiene 4 hijos. Salvador se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos usados. Sus hijos son consientes del sacrificio que realiza su padre y ayudan también en algunos quehaceres diarios en el hogar a tareas sencillas. Los sueños de Salvador es ampliar su vivienda y el negocio para generar más ingresos para el hogar. El crédito que solicita es  para la compra de repuestos usados de vehículos ya que tiene ciertos encargos pendientes. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Salvador Antonio is 42 years old, married and has four children. He runs a business selling spare parts from used cars. His children are aware of the sacrifices that their father makes for them and help him with some of the small daily tasks around the home. Salvador is requesting a loan to purchase used spare parts as he already has orders pending. He dreams of increasing his business to provide a better service and generate more home income.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Iveth Magdalena

texts.es:
la señora Iveth Magdalena O. D. tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos.
radica en la comunidad de Jicaro Galan, 
Iveth tiene una venta de refrescos en su casa de habitacion esta actividad la realiza desde hace unos 6 años.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas refrescos al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y mayores ganancias.

su sueño es tener un buen local para montar su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iveth Magdalena Ordóñez Domínguez, 25, is a single mother of two children. She lives in Jicaro Galan. Iveth has sold soft drinks from her home for the last 6 years. She will use the funds to buy more soft drinks at wholesale in order to get better prices and thus higher profits. Her dream is to have a good locale in which to set up her store and be able to service more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials like cement to repair his home and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Meidel Pastora

texts.es: La Señora Meidel Pastora. Tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de leña, mariscos y otros, labora todos los días de la semana y lleva en esta actividad hace 4 años, lo inicio cuando estaba embarazada y no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia, por lo que recorría lugares muy lejanos. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como leña, mariscos entre otros pues siempre le ha gustado luchar y trabajar. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meidel Pastora is 24 years old, is married and has a 4 year old son. She sells firewood, seafood and other items. Meidel works everyday and has done so for 4 years, she began when she was pregnant and did not have a source of income to sustain her family and had to go to far-off places to work. The loan will be used to invest to buy more merchandize like firewood, seafood among other items since she has always enjoyed working hard. Her goal is to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  electronic pieces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials like cement, sand and stone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer and to maintain the cyber café.

loans.name: Celia Georgina

texts.es:
Celia de 54 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda general vende víveres y todo tipo de productos de uso personal. 

Hace 15 años atrás trabajo como empleada domestica pero como los ingresos no le ayudaban mucho, tuvo que retirarse y comenzar con su propio negocio con la ayuda de su esposo pudo comprar algunos víveres y papelería. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder variar mas sus artículos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería, confites y víveres. En el futuro quiere arreglar su negocio y construir mejor su vivienda.
texts.en:
Celia, age 54, lives in El Guasazo de Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the inhabitants are informal merchants). She has a general store, and she sells groceries and all types of personal use products. Fifteen years ago she worked as a domestic employee. But, as the income did not help her much, she had to stop doing that and start her own business. With her husband’s help she was able to buy some groceries and paper. Now she works from eight in the morning until nine at night everyday. In order to be able to have a greater variety of products, she wants to use the loan to buy paper, sweets, and groceries. In the future she wants to fix up her business and build her house better.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paper and sweets

loans.name: Roxy Llusvel

texts.es:
Roxy es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en la ciudad de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de pescado procesado como seco – salado desde hace cuatro años. Ella ofrece en venta este producto en las ciudad de Guadalupe y diversas zonas aledañas, y adquiere su mercadería en algunos terminales pesqueros y mercados mayoristas de la zona, el negocio le brinda algunos ingresos estables que utiliza en apoyar a su esposo, que trabaja como peón agrícola, con los gastos familiares.

Roxy desea conservar de mejor manera los productos que ofrece, para ello ha creído conveniente solisitar una refrigeradora, como no cuenta con el suficiente capital para adquirirla se ha vistoen la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Roxy es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir laborando arduamente para ayudar a su esposo a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Roxy, age 27, lives with her husband and their dependent child. They live in the city of Guadalupe, which belongs to the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad department. It is located over an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling processed fish like dried and salted for four years. She sells in the city of Guadalupe and in other neighboring areas. She gets her merchandise in some fishing terminals and wholesale markets in the area. The business provides some stable income, which is used to help her husband with the family expenses. He works as an agricultural laborer. Roxy wishes to preserve the products she sells in a better way. That is why she believes that it is advisable to request a refrigerator. She does not have enough money to get one. She has seen the necessity of requesting, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 soles. Roxy is a woman who is devoted to her family and her work. Her greatest desire is to continue working arduously in order to help her husband improve the family’s quality of life. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a level-headed and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator to preserve the dried fish she sells in a better way

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustín tiene 35años, su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal.  Inicio este negocio por medio de su hermano, ya que le había prestado el dinero para que empezara su propio negocio tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El nos cuenta que no es la prima vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido beneficiosos. Por lo que ha sido una persona muy responsable y se siente muy contento. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de equipos de pesca, redes, líneas de pesca entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Noel Agustín is 35 years old. He is a small-scale fisherman. He started this business by means of his brother who lent him the money to start his own business. Noel has two minor children under his care. He tells us that this is not the first time he has worked with loans, and they have been beneficial. He has been a very responsible person, and he is very content. He is now requesting this loan for working capital. He will buy fishing equipment, nets, and fishing lines, among other things. He dreams of improving his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Various products for her business: rice, corn, beans, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplies for making home improvements

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, menores de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, ella vende calzado, perfumes, tratamientos y ropa. Ella ya tiene 2 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido a los pocos ingresos que tenia decide dedicarse a este negocio. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más para ganarles más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Carolina is 46 years old and a single mother of 3 children, all minors. She sells merchandise in general, footwear, perfumes, beauty treatments and clothing. She has been in this business for 2 years and started because she had very low income. She would like this loan in order to purchase a variety of products and would like to sell more so she can earn more. Furthermore, the products are becoming more expensive every day and this has become a challenge for her because the country´s economic situation is becoming more difficult every day. She hopes to keep her business going and to always try to have her children study and prepare themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Wilson; El socio tiene 32 años de edad y él socio es conviviente, el tiene 1 hijo y el socio trabaja en diferentes agencias de viajes, El socio es guía de turismo. El socio trabaja desde hace 6 años como guía, el va por las rutas de aventura como camino inka, river rafting, mountain bike, El estuvo los primeros meses muy preocupados como otros guías, por el problema de las inundaciones que azotó a la ciudad del Cusco estuvieron sin trabajo y esto ocasionó que el socio alquile un local en el centro de la ciudad y ponga masajes terapéuticos, y con este nuevo negocio propio se está ayudando muy bien ahora que todo se está normalizando en la ciudad.  El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar los alquileres de su local.

El socio valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member, Wilson, belongs to the "DINAMICO" communal bank. He lives in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. He is 32 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has 1 child. He works for different travel agencies as tour guide. He has been working as a guide for 6 years on such adventure routes as the Inca trail, river rafting and mountain biking. Like other guides, he was very worried at the beginning of the year about the flooding that struck the city of Cusco. Being without work led him to rent a storefront in the city center and start a massage therapy business. The business is going very well now that the city is returning to normal. He is requesting a loan to pay for the rental of his store´s premises. He values and appreciates the loan, since it will enable him to grow and to have a better standard of living. He is also committed to meeting his payment obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for rental of store premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory: men´s and women´s fragrances, clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: COMPLETING THE PURCHASE OF LAND ON WHICH TO BUILD HIS OWN HOUSE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING TWO MILK COWS

loans.name: Jenny Noemí

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo de tres años, reside en el distrito de Túcume, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus atractivos, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la confección de casacas y buzos para colegios en un pequeño taller situado en la vivienda donde reside, ella realiza su trabajo en base a pedidos y cuenta con una máquina de coser semi – industrial. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, ya que le permite ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares.

Jenny desea adquirir materiales como telas e hilos para poder seguir trabajando y cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Jenny es una mujer tranquila y bastante responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajuando para brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y clientes le consideran una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 22, lives with her husband and their small, three year old child. They live in the Túcume district. This area is known on a regional level for its attractions. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has been making jackets and sweatshirts for schools. She makes them in a small shop in her home. She does her work based on orders, and she has a semi-industrial sewing machine. This business is an important source of income for the family’s finances. It allows her to help her husband pay the family expenses. Jenny wishes to get materials like fabric and thread to be able to keep working and fill some orders that she has pending. In order to do so she believes that it is prudent to request a loan, for the first time, for 400 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Jenny is a level-headed and very responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to keep working in order to give her family the opportunity to have a better quality of life. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be a hard-working and diligent woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and fabric to expand her business of making school sweatshirts

loans.name: Blanca Dunia

texts.es: La  señora Blanca Dunia B. se ha dedicado a la actividad de peluquería en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde atiendo a sus clientes que le visitan. En dicha peluquería también vende  cosméticos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. El crédito que está solicitando será invertido directamente en la compra de productos para continuar con el trabajo de la peluquería y de igual para la compra de los cosméticos y así continuar en dicha labor.
texts.en:
Blanca is a businesswoman who sells cosmetics and costume jewelry and works as a barber. She has worked as a barber for six years in her husband’s barber shop. When he is not in the shop, she helps with shaving the customers that arrive. She also sells cosmetics and clothing from her house. She is married and now has a son. She has had two loans from CEPRODEL and has used them to expand her merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: payment for new clothing, jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For Personal Expenses

loans.name: Marcia Marina

texts.es: La señora Marcia se dedica a la actividad de docencia o maestra de un colegio del municipio de Nagarote desde hace 25 años de experiencia habiendose destacado como una excelente maestra.El crédito lo solicita para gastos de medicamentos  ya que en la actualidad su padre necesita una operación porque ha tenido la dificultad de poder caminar y para ello hace uso de unas muletas y ella como buena hija quiere apoyarle en parte de sus gastos.
texts.en:
Marcia is a teacher for the municipality of Nagarote with 25 years of experience teaching primary school. She is requesting this loan for medical expenses because now her father needs an operation. Her father needs crutches to walk and as she is a good daughter, she wants to support him by helping with the expenses along with her other siblings.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de medicamentos

loans.name: Beyris Patricia

texts.es: La señora Beyris G. es trabajadora de un pequeño colegio publico el cuál tiene  catorce años de desempeñarse como Maestra de Educación Primaria. Ha venido buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida por medio de la reconstrucción de su vivienda. El crédito lo está solicitando para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación para así mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Beyris is hard-working and active in the local public school called “Monte limar” where she has worked for fourteen years as a primary school teacher. She has had twelve loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase construction materials and make improvements to her home. These improvements have greatly improved the quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as blocks, concrete, bricks

loans.name: Linda Urania

texts.es: La señora Linda Urania G. es comerciante y se dedica al negocio  de abarrotes en su propio local donde vende dichos abarrotes. Ella tiene  dos  años de dedicarse a este negocio y se esfuerza por mejorar las condiciones de sutienda de abarrotes. Con el crédito comprará los productos para continuar ofertandolos en la tienda de abarrotes y así satisfacer a todos sus clientes que le visitan para la compra de dichos productos.
texts.en:
Linda is a businesswoman who works selling grocery items. She has worked in this business which is a store operating out of her home for two years. She has had ten loans from CEPRODEL and has used all of them to expand her merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as basic grains and for expanding the business

loans.use: He will use the loan to buy construction materials in order to replace the roof of his house and plaster some walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement and cinderblocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, cinderblocks, window frames and glass, and skilled labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her house, and for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito agricola conformado por varias zonas rurales que se encuentran bastante separadas entre si, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de medicamentos en una farmacia desde hace dos años, el cuenta con un local ubicado cerca al centro del pueblo central, este negocio tiene mucha acogida ya que sus principales clientes son las personas que residen en los diversos centros poblados de la zona y no cuentan con dinero suficiente para trasladarse a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlas. Con las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres con el sostenimiento familiar.

Yuri desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas medicina para poder satisfacer de mejor manera la demanda con la que cuenta, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es un joven emprendedor, ha sabido hacer crecer su negocio con mucho esfuerzo. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran un joven honesto y responsable.
texts.en:
Yuri is 34 years old and single. He lives with his family in the Olmos district. It is an agricultural district, which is comprised of various rural areas that are quite separate from each other. This district belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is over two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been selling medicine in a pharmacy for two years. He has a place, which is located close to the center of the town. This business is very well received because his main customers are the people who live in the diverse populated centers in the area. The customers do not have enough money to go to the city of Chiclayo to get the medicines. With the earnings from this activity he helps his parents support the family. Yuri wishes to expand his business by purchasing more medicine. He wants to do this to be able to better satisfy the customer demand. To achieve his goal he thinks it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,200 soles. This will help him achieve his objective. He is an enterprising young man who has known how, with great effort, to make his business grow. In the area where he lives his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be an honest and responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine to expand his business, a pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her home by repairing the electrical system and plastering some walls.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a middle-aged woman who lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married without any children. To earn a living, she works as a tailor, repairing and sewing clothes. She has another financial earner in her husband who owns a workshop along the street where he provides a hair-cutting service. Mrs. S. requests a loan of $200 in order to buy clothing for sewing activities. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured here)

loans.use: To buy clothing for sewing activities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as zinc, iron, stone, cinderblocks, sand, and skilled labor.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros S. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo. She has three young children who attend school and depend on her income. A year ago, she started a job as a sewing employee in the garment industry, while her husband has been a construction foreman for eight years. He has a few employees who help provide his service. Ros S. will be using the part of the loan she requested to pay school fees for her children, and any remaining cash from the loan she will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children and to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the roof of her house-corrugated iron roofing, joists

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon P., 55, lives in Phnom Penh. She is a crop farmer growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. She is married and has three children who live together in the family home. To facilitate the work on the farm, her husband works frequently alongside her. In addition, Nuon P.'s husband takes time to operate a motor-taxi service. Growing crops is something with which the couple has had great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Nuon P. is looking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Félix Antonio

texts.es: En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, el señor Felix M. está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción con el propósito de invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda para proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo. Se siente muy satisfecho porque está seguro que obtendrá dicho crédito y así saldra adelante en su desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Félix Antonio M. N. is an active employee of the Barceló Monte Limar hotel. He has worked for this institution for one year, in the position of pastry chef. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL; he used one to complete the purchase of a plot of land, and he is requesting the current loan in order to buy construction materials and carry out improvements to his home. The loans have benefited him greatly, allowing him to improve his standard of living and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completing the purchase of a plot of land

loans.name: 03.01.23 Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Hoa T. T. (114) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 23-Cho Dien Bien (03.01.23Dien Bien).

Hoa is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Hoa owns & operates a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2009, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Hoa has successfully repaid her first loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to renovate the business.  She is now requesting her second loan, for 5,310,000 VND, which will again be used for business renovation.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Phuc (115) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


2.  N. T. Phuong (173) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


3.  N. T. Thu (172) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


4.  N. T. H. Ha (171) is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


5.  N. T. H. Nga (121) is a 42 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


6.  N. T. Tam (123) is a 31 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


7.  N. T. Ngoc (122) is a 46 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,310,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa T. T. (114) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 23- Cho Dien Bien (03.01.23Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.310.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Phuc (115) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


2.  N. T. Phuong (173) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


3.  N. T. Thu (172) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


4.  N. T. H. Ha (171) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


5.  N. T. H. Nga (121) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


6.  N. T. Tam (123) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


7.  N. T. Ngoc (122) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.310.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: business renovation

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie S. is a young mother who aims to become successful someday by increasing her fishing business while her husband closely works with her as a fisherman. They work together for the future of their family. Lorie is thankful to ASHI, for through the loans they have provided since 1998, she has been able to support her fishing operation by purchasing a motor boat, fishing net, and other tools of her business. She is hoping to raise more fish to sell in the future through hard work and the continuous assistance of ASHI and Kiva. 

Because a lack of business capital encouraged her to look for financial support from KIVA lenders, Lorie will be glad when her loan request is granted; she will utilize the loan wisely by purchasing an additional fishing boat and fishing net. Lorie’s hard work and patience are her foundation in bettering her family's life.  

The income she gets from the business is very helpful in supporting the business itself and meeting the needs of her family, especially in providing school allowances for her three children. She hopes that someday she will be able to expand her fishing business further. She is glad for the secured opportunity of taking this loan and for your support and encouragement. Lorie hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing boat and net

loans.name: Esmilda Zelena

texts.es: La señora Esmilda R. se ha dedicado en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace seis años. Ella es madre de dos niños en edad escolar y siempre busca la manera de proporcionarles las condiciones de vida necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen. El motivo por el que solicita el crédito es para la compra de la ropa para la venta debido a que se le ha agotado y requiere satisfacer a sus clientes. Ella espera que dicho crédito le sea otorgado y así mejorar la situación económica del negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esmilda Zelena R. Gutiérrez is a businesswoman who sells new clothing. She has worked with this business for six years, selling the clothing from door to door. She is married and has two school-aged children. Esmilda has had four loans from Ceprodel, and she has taken them out to expand her inventory and improve her business. This has been a great benefit to her because in this way she has improved living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assorted new clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase roofing materials: zinc sheets, perlins and labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of insecticide, urea, etc. and plowing the land

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Her husband’s support of her farming business is Paquita’s inspiration to keep working through the challenges of poverty and growing her business despite that. The farming business has brought pleasure to Paquita’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support the family’s needs. Being a good mother, Paquita has always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would follow to better their own lives. 

Aside from Paquita’s farming business financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a hog raising business which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially for her grandchildren’s education until college. For that, Paquita is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase fertilizers,“palay” (unhusked rice), and support her hog raising business. This will make their business grow and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambitions in life.

Paquita has been an ASHI member since 1998. Her family is very glad that she has an opportunity to improve their quality of living through the income of the farming business she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and rice seed; maintaining hog raising business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely T. is a 62-year-old mother of five. She is married to a farmer who works a small parcel of their land. Her husband is also hired by other people in their village during the rice planting and harvest season. This livelihood of hers started more than 10 years ago, but improving the family's living conditions remains impossible. 

Fely applied for this loan to finance fertilizers, insecticides, and other supplies. She wants to buy these items in advance in order to get a lower price, and to avoid borrowing money from her neighbor during planting season. When she borrows from her neighbor, she usually pays back in rice grains after harvest which is very disadvantageous to her. Fely hopes that through her loan, she and her husband can save their harvest and get a better price at market. Fely also engaged her second venture--raising livestock in their wide and verdant backyard for supplementary income.

Fely and her husband lack the education that is required to be employed. Therefore, they have used their own skills to earn money for their children and to survive. Fely has never wanted anything else in her life as a mother other than to give her children a better future by sending them to school through college. However, she failed with her four eldest children, because some of them married at an early age and others stopped going to school and worked instead. Fely's last hope is youngest child who is in the fourth year of high school and will soon be in college, and, also, her grandchildren. 

She also wants to have an electricity connection for their farm’s operation and to build a better house for the family.

loans.use: buying fertilizers, insecticides, and other supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer V. is from the village of Punit. She is 30 years old. Jennifer is married and has two infant children. Jennifer owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennifer is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) and was used purchase additional products to sell.

Jennifer is now requesting her third loan from ASKI, for 9000 PHP, which will also be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita P. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Purok Mabi-abihon, Brgy. Consuelo, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: farming and selling meat products.

Nenita’s husband, Romeo, is a driver and they have nine children from 17 to 35 years old. One of their children is currently going to school and also helps in the business, while the other eight children are already working on their own livelihoods.

Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in farming and selling meat by delivery. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Nenita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 was used to fund operations of her meat sales business. The loan had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 20th loan, the amount of PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy fertilizer for her farm. Nenita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

The accompanying picture of Nenita was taken with her standing crop of sugarcane in the background.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila G. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Precila is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Precila owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Precila has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Precila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Precila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Precila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita A. is a married woman who lives in Purok Hugno, Manalad, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures. She sells firewood and charcoal, and she has a tricycle transport businesses.  

Nerlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nerlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus improving the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her thirteenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to do repairs and maintenance to her tricycle and as additional revolving capital for her charcoal and firewood business. She intends to continue to save for their future and to do house repairs. Nerlita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Tricycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella M., from the village of Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya, is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables to the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Bella plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry A., from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela, is 47 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Jerry owns and operates a specialized retail store selling home products such as kitchen utensils. Engaged in her business for over 13 years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jerry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Jerry plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

Juvilyn V., from the village of Punit, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juvilyn owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juvilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 10000 PHP for the same purpose. Juvilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia F., from the city of San Jose, Santiago City, is 45 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Leticia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of perishable and non-perishable products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Leticia's third loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria E. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures. She sews curtains, and she sells ukay-ukay (used clothes) and ready-to-wear clothes. She lives in Sitio Purit, Brgy. Cabito-onan, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5000. 

Apolinaria is now borrowing PHP 22000 so that she can purchase more inventory for her curtain business. This will be her thirteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Apolinaria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing

texts.en:
Miss SokChamroeun P. is single and lives with her widowed mother and brother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her mother runs a grocery store from their home.

Photo: Sokchamroeun is standing in front of her mother’s grocery store.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a resident of Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan. She is a housewife and spends her time at home doing her household chores. Khursheed’s husband operates a rice-selling business. 

She is the mother of six children. Unfortunately none of them is literate. All four of her sons are working: her eldest son operates a donkey cart; the second son takes orders for handkerchiefs from different shops; the third son has a vehicle tire shop; and the youngest son does embroidery work.  Her daughters help her with the domestic chores. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Asasah for her eldest son who wants to buy his own donkey cart instead of renting one.  This is her first loan from any MFI. She hopes that this investment will prove successful for her son and he will be able to increase his income by improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart

She wants to supplement with a new business by purchasing finished silk fabric from fellow villagers for resale. But she does not have capital; hence, she is requesting her second loan of $1,100 to launch the business.

That’s why he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to use for the purpose. He also will use a part of the loan to make the door of his house because he just built a concrete brick room.

loans.name: Zahida Begum's Group

texts.en:
Zahida Begum has lived in Multan city for the last 12 years in a three-room brick house. Multan is the fourth largest city of Pakistan.
 
A very caring lady, Zahida stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family. She is an illiterate lady. She couldn’t get a proper education because her parents were not in a position to afford her education expenses.
 
She got married at the age of 18 and has given birth to two sons. Both of her sons are not of school-going age yet. She has a dream to send her kids to school so they never face the hard time she faced without being literate.  

Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a private entrepreneur who purchases clothes from different cities and sells them in both his native city and in different communities as well. He has been doing this work for over seven years. He has obtained a good reputation among his customers. His selection in clothes is always admired by his customers. He also keeps himself aware of the new designs and fabrics in clothes to attract more customers to his work. 

He generates an income of approximately 15,000 Pakistan rupees, which enables him to meet the financial expenses. Zahida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy clothes in bulk, which will cut his traveling expenses. He will be able to re-invest the profit amount in his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for reselling
